si: <entryFree id="n44096" type="main" key="si_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sī</orth> (orig. and ante-class. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">seī</orth>), <sense id="n44096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [from a pronominal stem = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(</foreign>; Sanscr. sva-, self; cf. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 778; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. 396" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. 396</bibl>], a conditional particle, <hi rend="ital">if.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44096.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n44096.2" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.;</hi> so in gen., in conditions which are assumed to be true, with the verb in <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perf.;</hi> less freq. in <hi rend="ital">imperf</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pluperf.;</hi> and in conditions which may probably become true, with the verb in <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> (Madv. Gram. § 332; Zumpt, Gram. § 517). </sense><sense id="n44096.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pres.</hi>: SI IN IVS VOCAT, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 25</bibl>, and ap. Porphyr. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 65</bibl>: SI MORBVS AEVITASVE VITIVM ESCIT ... SI NOLET, etc., id. ap. Gell. l. l.: spero, si speres quicquam prodesse potis sunt, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=333" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 333</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 410 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">si vis, dabo tibi testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 37, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si voltis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si placet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 44, 71</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 21, 34: si tuo commodo fleri potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si studia Graecorum vos tanto opere delectant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si populus plurimum potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Massilienses per delectos cives summā justitiā reguntur, inest tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 8, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, Catilina, quod jam amplius exspectes, si nec privata domus continere voces conjurationis tuae potest? si illustrantur, si erumpunt omnia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pudor quaeritur, si probitas, si fides, Mancinus haec attulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:18:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 18, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Si quaerimus, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:325" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 95, 325</bibl></cit>. —Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">modo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnifica quidem res, si modo est ulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliget populus, si modo salvus esse vult, optimum quemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (virtus) est una, si modo est, maxime munifica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 182</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quisquam est facilis, hic est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ulla res est, quam tibi me petente faciendam putes, haec ea sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SI AGNATVS NEC ESCIT, GENTILIS FAMILIAM NANCITOR, Fragm. XII. Tab. in Collat. Leg. Mos. et Rom. 16, 4: quae (libertas), si aequa non est, ne libertas quidem est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 31, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 32, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id si minus intellegitur, ex dissensionibus percipi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: BACANALIA SEI QVA SVNT, EXSTRAD QVAM SEI QVID IBEI SACRI EST ... FACIATIS VTEI DISMOTA SIENT, S. C. de Bacch. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicito, si quid vis, non nocebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui sunt, qui philosophorum auctoritate moveantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid generis istiusmodi me delectat, pictura delectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliquid dandum est voluptati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 13, 44</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">four times repeated,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 38</bibl></cit>.—So esp. after mirum est or miror, as expressing reality (= quod or cum; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">noli mirari, si hoc non impetras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:11:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 11, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid mirum est, si tam ab amico animo pacem petit? Curt 4, 11, 4: miraris, si superbiam tuam ferre non possumus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 7, 14</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With a negative conclusion, to denote that, although the condition is true, or is conceded, a certain inference does not follow: nec, si omne enuntiatum aut verum aut falsum est, sequitur ilico esse causas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec. si non obstatur, propterea etiam permittitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si veniam meretur qui inprudens nocuit, non meretur praemium qui inprudens profuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ideo ignis minus urere potest, si in materiam incidit inviolabilem flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:5:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Imperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea si erant, magnas habebas omnibus, dis gratias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:27:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 27, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis antea mirabatur, quid esset, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">SI MEMBRVM RVPIT NI CVM EO PACIT TALIO ESTO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. Fest. s. v. talio, p. 363 Müll.: si animum contulisti in istam rationem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:23:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 23, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Roma condita est secundo anno Olympiadis septimae, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (tyrannos) si boni oppresserunt, recreatur civitas: sin audaces, fit illa factio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ita sensit, ut loquitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21, 32</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 27, 43: si modo hoc in Lycurgi potestate potuit esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo in philosophiā aliquid profecimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 8, 37</bibl></cit>: si quis eorum <pb n="1689" /> <cb n="SI" /> (servorum) sub centone crepuit, nullum mihi vitium facit, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. prohibere, p. 234 sq. Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid sceleste fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quam opinionem jam vestris mentibus comprehendistis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando regi justo vim populus attulit regnove eum spoliavit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 42, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl>.—After mirum est or miror, to express a reality (cf. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>, supra): <cit><quote lang="la">minime mirum, si ista res adhuc nostrā linguā inlustrata non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mirum, si haec invitus amisi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miraris, si eo tempore matrona dicere potuit, escende?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minime est mirandum, si vita ejus fuit secura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—Very often followed by certe, profecto, etc., to express a conclusion, as certain as the unquestionable assumption: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si fuit in re publicā tempus ullum, cum, etc., tum profecto fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quisquam fuit umquam remotus ab inani laude, ego profecto is sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etenim si nulla fuit umquam tam imbecillo mulier animo, quae, etc., certe nos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si umquam in dicendo fuimus aliquid, tum profecto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 19</bibl>.—Esp. with a negative conclusion (v. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> supra, and cf. quia, etsi): <cit><quote lang="la">non, si tibi ante profuit, semper proderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non, si Opimium defendisti, idcirco te isti bonum civem putabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:40:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 40, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim, si tuae res gestae ceterorum laudibus obscuritatem attulerunt, idcirco Pompeii memoriam amisimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, si capitis dolorem facit, inutilis hominibus sol est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pluperf.</hi>: si improbum Cresphontem existimaveras, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 24, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mirum, eos si orationes turbaverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 20, 2</bibl></cit> (Trag. v. 156 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc ita fato datum erat, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30, 3</bibl></cit>.—So esp. in indef. clauses of repeated action: <cit><quote lang="la">plausum si quis eorum aliquando acceperat, ne quid peccasset pertimescebat,</quote> <trans><tr>whenever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:49:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 49, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando nostri navem religaverant, hostes succurrebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando suis fortunis forte desperare coeperant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Fut.</hi>: SI VOLET SVO VIVITO ... SI VOLET PLVS DATO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:45" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 45</bibl>; cf.: si voles advortere animum, comiter monstrabitur, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=89" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 89</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 386 Vahl.); and: <cit><quote lang="la">alte spectare si voles, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:23:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 23, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si jam eminebit foras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 26, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me audietis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mutuas non potero certum est sumam fenore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id persequar, si potero, subtilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll. <foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil (offendet) si modo opus exstabit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid te volam, ubi eris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 96</bibl></cit>: si quod aliud <foreign lang="greek">oi)kei=on</foreign> reperies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 10, 3</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Fut. perf.</hi>: si te hic offendero, moriere, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 26, 1</bibl> (Trag. v. 301 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">si nostram rem publicam vobis et nascentem et crescentem ostendero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum magis assentiere, si ad majora pervenero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expediri quae restant vix poterunt, si hoc incohatum reliqueris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 55</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 24, 38: pergratum mihi feceris, si de amicitiā disputaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accommodabo ad eam (rem publicam), si potuero, omnem illam orationem, etc. ... quod si tenere et consequi potuero, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:46:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 46, 70</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">si potuero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 5, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si potuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 23, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo id exprimere Latine potuero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo interpretari potuero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ne ei caput exoculassitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: si quid vos per laborem recte feceritis ... Sed si quā per voluptatem nequiter feceritis, etc., Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de iis te, si qui me forte locus admonuerit, commonebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.7" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.;</hi> so in gen. of conditions assumed in statement, but implied not to be actual; the verb in <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> (rarely <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>) implies that the condition is still possible; in the <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi>, that it is known to be unreal (Madv. Gram. § 347 sqq.; Zumpt, Gram. § 524). </sense><sense id="n44096.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si habeat aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abire hinc nullo pacto possim, si velim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">si velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:10:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipsi auxilium ferre, si cupiant, non queant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si singulos numeremus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: si jus suum populi<cb n="SI" />  teneant, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Scipionis desiderio me moveri negem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad verba rem deflectere velimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis varias gentes despicere possit, videat primum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 14</bibl></cit>.—In expressing a wish (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for utinam), usu. with O: <cit><quote lang="la">O si angulus ille accedat, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">O mihi praeteritos referat si Juppiter annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 560</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also alone: si nunc se nobis ille aureus arbore ramus Ostendat nemore in tanto!</quote> <trans><tr>would that</tr>, <tr>yet if</tr>, <tr>if however</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quā fata aspera rumpas, Tu Marcellus eris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 882</bibl></cit>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>, infra.—</sense><sense id="n44096.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Imperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui si unus omnia consequi posset, nihil opus esset pluribus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae descriptio si esset ignota vobis, explicaretur a me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ullum probarem simplex rei publicae genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non fecissent profecto, si nihil ad eos pertinere arbitrarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:51:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 51, § 133</bibl>; v. Zumpt, Gram. § 525: SEI QVES ESENT, QVEI SIBEI DEICERENT, S. C. de Bacch (twice). —Also with O, expressing a wish (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">O si solitae quicquam virtutis adesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 415</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and without O: si mihi, quae quondam fuerat ... si nunc foret illa juventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 398</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.10" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Perf.</hi>: SI INIVRIAM FAXIT ALTERI, VIGINTI QVINQVE AERIS POENAE SVNTO, Fragm. XII. Tabularum ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 12</bibl>: si jam data sit frux, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 724</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 412 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">perii, si me aspexerit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus sum, si dixeris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani si casu intervenerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:5:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 5, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.11" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pluperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliter accidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum magis id diceres, si nuper in hortis Scipionis affuisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansisset eadem voluntas in eorum posteris, si regum similitudo permansisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 41, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id fecisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis in caelum ascendisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliquid de summā gravitate Pompeius remisisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44096.12" n="c" level="4"> Ellipt. </sense><sense id="n44096.13" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pron. indef</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istae artes, si modo aliquid, valent, ut acuant ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut nemo, aut, si quisquam, ille sapiens fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 29, 103</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.14" n="(b)" level="5"> In a negation, usu. si minus, si contra (= sin minus, sin aliter): <cit><quote lang="la">plures haec tulit una civitas, si minus sapientes, at certe summā laude dignos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">educ tecum omnes tuos: si minus, quam plurimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 16, 68</bibl>, in this sense less freq. si non: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum cetera nomina digesta habes an non? Si non ... si etiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec civitas est, civem esse me: si non, exsulem esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:104 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 104 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 29, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic venit in judicium, si nihil aliud, saltem ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 152</bibl></cit>; so, si nihil aliud, Liv 22, 29; 30, 35; 45, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliud nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:2:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.15" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">forte</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intelleges esse nihil a me nisi orationis acerbitatem et, si forte, raro litterarum missarum indiligentiam reprehensam,</quote> <trans><tr>perhaps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor, ne nihil sim tui, nisi supplosionem pedis imitatus et pauca quaedam verba et aliquem, si forte, motum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.16" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if however</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si in philosophiā tantum interest ... quid tandem in causis existimandum est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si fuit in re publicā tempus ullum ... tum profecto fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si exemeris ex rerum naturā benevolentiae conjunctionem, nec domus ulla nec urbs stare poterit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si non hic tantus fructus ostenderetur et si ex his studiis delectatio sola peteretur: tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:18:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 18, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.17" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44096.18" n="1" level="3"> In subject or object-clauses, si with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> sometimes takes the place of an <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Graecos opprobrio fuit adulescentibus, si amatores non haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: summa gloria constat ex tribus his; <cit><quote lang="la">si diligit multitudo, si fidem habet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unam esse spem salutis docent, si eruptione factā extremum auxilium experirentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud ignoscere aequum erit, si ... ne tuam quidem gloriam praeponam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 41, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 4, 3</bibl>: infinitum est, si singulos velim persequi. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:17:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 17, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 16:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 16, 2</bibl> (cf. si after mirum <cb n="SI" /> est, I. a. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> supra).—</sense><sense id="n44096.19" n="2" level="3"> In subst. clauses, to denote a doubtful assumption or future event (cf. quod): <cit><quote lang="la">dixerunt, in eo verti puellae salutem, si postero die vindex injuriae ad tempus praesto esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjecerunt, Scipionem in eo positam habuisse spem pacis, si Hannibal et Mago ex Italiā non revocarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:18" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 18</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n44096.20" n="3" level="3"> Si with a relative takes the place of a relative clause, to express a class the existence or extent of which is doubtful: mortem proposuit, non eis solum qui illam rem gesserunt, sed eis etiam si qui non moleste tulerunt, i. e. <hi rend="ital">if such there were</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whether few</hi> or <hi rend="ital">many</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:18:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 18, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit errare, si qui in bello omnis secundos rerum proventus expectent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errat, si quis existimat facilem rem esse donare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 13, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.21" n="4" level="3"> In syllogistic reasonings: <cit><quote lang="la">si oportet velle sapere, dare operam philosophiae convenit. Oportet autem velle sapere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:36:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 36, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si enim est verum, quod ita conectitur: si quis oriente Caniculā natus est, in mari non morietur, illud quoque verum est: si Fabius oriente Canicula natus est, Fabius in mari non morietur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.22" n="5" level="3"> = etiamsi, with foll. <hi rend="ital">tamen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">although</hi>, <hi rend="ital">albeit</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae si exsequi nequirem, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 11, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si causa non esset, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si dubia essent, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.23" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in dependent clauses expressing an interrogation or doubt, it is nearly = num, but forms a looser connection, <hi rend="ital">if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whether</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if perchance</hi> (class., but very rare in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">ibo et visam huc ad eum, si forte est domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 118</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam sciam, si quid titubatum est, ubi reliquias videro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatis incerta feror, si Juppiter unam Esse velit urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ab iis quaesivit, si aquam hominibus in totidem dies, quot frumentum imposuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:50" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id modo quaeritur, si (lex) majori parti et in summam prodest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam dudum exspecto, si tuom officium scias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc (paludem) si nostri transirent, hostes exspectabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 34</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius eadem spectans, si itinere impeditos deprehendere posset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non recusavit quo minus vel extremo spiritu, si quam opem rei publicae ferre posset, experiretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:85:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 85, 398</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statui expectandum esse si quid certius adferretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philopoemen quaesivit si Lycortas incolumis evasisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expertique simul, si tela artusque sequantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:562" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetii nonnumquam interdiu, saepius noctu, si perrumpere possent, conati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">temptata res est, si primo impetu capi Ardea posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.24" n="B" level="2"> With ellipsis of a verb or clause on which the condition depends (cf. I. c. supra): ei rei suam operam dat, si possiet illam invenire (<hi rend="ital">to see</hi>) <hi rend="ital">whether he can</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Minucium cum omni equitatu praemittit, si quid celeritate itineris proficere possit,</quote> <trans><tr>to see</tr>, <tr>to try</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfunduntur hostes, si quem aditum reperire possent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fame et inopiā adductos clam ex castris exisse, si quid frumenti in agris reperire possent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 20, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 55</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 7, 89 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergit ad speluncam, si forte eo vestigia ferrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa volvebant, si quā Possent tectam aciem perrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Gonnum castra movet, si potiri oppido posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:67:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 67, 6</bibl></cit>: haud aspernatus Tullius, tamen, si vana adferantur, in aciem educit (<hi rend="ital">that he might be ready</hi>) <hi rend="ital">if</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 23, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites in praesidio erant, si quo operā eorum opus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii offerunt se, si quo usus operae sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: ille postea, si comitia sua non fierent, urbi minari, i. e. (<hi rend="ital">that he would attack it</hi>) <hi rend="ital">if</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginiensibus in Hasdrubale ita, si is movisset Syphacem, spes omnis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 35, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul aedem Fortunae vovit, si eo die hostis fudisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 36, 8</bibl></cit>: erat Athenis reo damnato, si fraus capitalis non esset, quasi <pb n="1690" /> <cb n="SIBI" /> poenae aestimatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 232</bibl>: quattuor legiones Cornelio, si qui ex Etruriā novi motus nuntiarentur, relictae, <hi rend="ital">to meet the case</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is in armis tenuit militem, si opus foret auxilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut patricios indignatio, si cum his gerendus esset honos, deterreret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 40, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:36" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44096.25" n="B" level="2"> Si ... si, for sive ... sive, <hi rend="ital">whether ... or</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si deus si dea es,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 139</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiam si deo, si deae immolabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:28:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 28, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
siagones: <entryFree id="n44097" type="greek" key="si^a_go^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭāgŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">siago/nes</foreign>, <sense id="n44097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the muscles which support the jaw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the maxillary muscles; acc.</hi> siagonas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:37" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:1:4:90" default="NO">1, 4, 90</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭāgŏnītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">siagoni=tai</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10:59" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 10, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:3:6" default="NO">2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:3:8" default="NO">2, 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sibe: <entryFree id="n44098" type="gloss" key="si^be^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭbĕ</orth>, <itype>for sibi</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 24</bibl>; v. sibi, under sui.</entryFree>
sibilatio: <entryFree id="n44099" type="main" key="si_bi^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sībĭlātĭo</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭfĭlātĭo</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 531, 4</bibl>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sibilo</etym>, <sense id="n44099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sibilation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hissing</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">serpentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel stridor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:14:198" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 14, 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sibilatrix: <entryFree id="n44100" type="hapax" key="si_bi^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sībĭlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <sense id="n44100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi> [sibilator], <hi rend="ital">hissing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whistling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula sibilatrix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 906</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sibilatus: <entryFree id="n44101" type="hapax" key="si_bi^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sībĭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sibilo</etym>, <sense id="n44101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hissing whistling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:27:144" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 27, 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sibilo: <entryFree id="n44102" type="main" key="si_bi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sībĭlo</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sīfĭlo</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 531, 2</bibl>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n44102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [sibilus] (class. but rare). </sense><sense id="n44102.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whistle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitationis hoc modo, ut majores rudere et vagire et mugire et murmurare et sibilare appellaverunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 31, 42</bibl></cit>: (serpens) sibilat ore, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:754" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 754</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of a serpent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 54; Ov M. 4, 588.—Of gossips: contemplent, conspiciant omnes, nutent, nictent, sibilent, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 72</bibl>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">illud (ferrum igne rubens) Stridet et in trepidā submersum sibilat undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridor rudentum sibilat,</quote> <trans><tr>whistles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:258" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 258</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrendo fragore sibilantibus armis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 12, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44102.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hiss</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to hiss at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hiss down</hi> a person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 2</bibl>: populus me sibilat; <cit><quote lang="la">at mihi plaudo Ipse domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sibilus: <entryFree id="n44103" type="main" key="si_bi^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sībĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (collat. form, <case>abl.</case>, sibilu, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 715</bibl> P.—In <number>plur.</number> in the poets, prob. merely for the sake of the metre: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sībĭla</orth>, ōrum; cf. 2. sibilus <sense id="n44103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; but in Cic. sibili), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">sifno/s, siblo/s</foreign>, hollow; Angl. S. and Engl. sipan, sip; O. H. Germ. sip, Germ. Sieb, a sieve; regarded by the ancients as imitation of a natural sound; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 31, 42</bibl></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a hissing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a whistling</hi> (class.) </sense><sense id="n44103.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n44103.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, of men: <cit><quote lang="la">sibilo dare signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Of cattle: <cit><quote lang="la">(boves) sibilo allectari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of things: clamor tonitruum et rudentum sibilus, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(arbor) Loquente saepe sibilum edidit coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venientis sibilus austri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 82</bibl></cit>: sibilu significare alicui, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 715</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n44103.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, of wind instruments: <cit><quote lang="la">calamorum sibila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1382</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pastoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 785</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:338" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 338</bibl>.—Of snakes, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens horrenda sibila misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibila dant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:493" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:670" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 670</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 684: sibila torsit draco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:726" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angues stridula fuderunt vibratis sibila linguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibila effundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 724</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vibrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:185" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 185</bibl></cit>; Corn. Sev. and Macer ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 61</bibl> P.—Of a flying missile: <cit><quote lang="la">stridentis sibila teli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:247" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 247</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:201" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 201</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44103.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a contemptuous hissing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hissing at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off</hi> (usually in <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n44103.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibilum metuis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 65</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44103.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e scaenā sibilis explodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sibilis consectari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebris totius contionis sibilis vexatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3, 6</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:59:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 59, 126</bibl>; cf.: gladiatorii sibili, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 61</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">quā dominus, quā advocati sibilis conscissi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44104" type="main" key="si_bi^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sībĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. sibilus</etym>, <sense id="n44104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hissing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whistling</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; occurring, on account of the metre, only in the form sibila; cf. 1. sibilus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">colla (colubrae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 421</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 277</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ora (anguium),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma torvae frontis (Panis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:50" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sibina: <entryFree id="n44105" type="greek" key="si^bi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭbĭna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭbyna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sibu/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n44105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of hunting-spear</hi>, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=336" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 336</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 496 Vahl.); Tert. adv. <cb n="SIC" /> Marc. 1, 1, as a transl. of <foreign />, Isa. 2, 4 (for which the Vulg. has lanceae).</sense></entryFree>
sibonis: <entryFree id="n44106" type="hapax" key="sibonis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sibonis</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, = sibina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 2</bibl>.</entryFree>
sibus: <entryFree id="n44107" type="gloss" key="sibus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sibus</orth>, <itype>callidus sive acutus</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=336" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 336</bibl> Vahl.; cf. persibus.</entryFree>
sibuzates: <entryFree id="n44108" type="main" key="Sibuza_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sibuzātes</orth>, <sense id="n44108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Aquitania</hi> (the mod. <hi rend="ital">Sobusse</hi> on the Adour, between Dax and Bayonne), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sibylla: <entryFree id="n44109" type="main" key="Si^bylla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭbylla</orth> (in many MSS. and edd. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭbul-la</orth>, e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 18</bibl> Ritter), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>,= <foreign lang="greek">*si/bulla</foreign>, <sense id="n44109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female soothsayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prophetess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sibyl</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 6, 7</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 23; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 735</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">has (litteras), credo, nisi Sibylla legerit, Interpretari alium potesse neminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: terrae vis Pythiam Delphis incitabat: naturae Sibyllam. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 34</bibl>.—In Roman mythology, the most celebrated is the Sibyl at Cumae, in the service of Apollo; <cit><quote lang="la">in the time of Æneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:104 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 104 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 712</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 98</bibl>.—A later Sibyl in the time of Tarquinius Superbus, whose predictions were deposited in the Capitol, and in time of danger were consulted by a college of priests, appointed for that special purpose (at first duumviri, afterwards decemviri and quindecemviri, v. h. vv.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:19:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 19, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:97 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 43, 97 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 445</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 8, 8</bibl>.—A later Sibyl, burnt by Stilicho, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Itin. 2, 51</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 4, p. 49 sq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭ-byllīnus</orth> (written SIBVLLIN., <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2276, p. 394</bibl>, and Calend. Praenest. M. Apr. ib. tom. ii. p. 389), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Sibyl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sibylline</hi>: libri, Varr. l. l.; Gell. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 15</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 9</bibl>; 29, 10; 36, 37; 41, 21 al. (they are called simply libri in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 1</bibl>; 22, 36; 22, 57; <cit><quote lang="la">and libri fatales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 10</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">vaticinationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sibyna: <entryFree id="n44110" type="main" key="si^by^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭbyna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. sibina.</entryFree>
sic: <entryFree id="n44111" type="main" key="si_c"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīc</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sīce</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 12</bibl>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">seic</orth>, C. I. L. 818), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>for si - ce; si, locat. form of pron. stem sa- = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o(, a(</foreign>, or <foreign lang="greek">h(</foreign>, and demonstr. -ce; v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 777</etym>, <sense id="n44111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in this</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in such a manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the same</hi> way or <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in like manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likewise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to this</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that extent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to such a degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in this</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in such a condition</hi> (syn. ita); sic refers, I. To a previous fact, description, or assumption.—II. To a subsequent independent sentence, = <hi rend="ital">thus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as follows.</hi>—III. As a local demonstrative (<foreign lang="greek">deiktikw=s</foreign>), referring to something done or pointed out by the speaker, = <hi rend="ital">thus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as I do it; thus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as you see</hi>, etc.—IV. As a correlative, preceding or following clauses introduced by conjunctions. —V. In certain idiomatic connections. </sense><sense id="n44111.1" n="I" level="1"> Referring to something said before, = hoc modo: sic ille annus duo firmamenta rei publicae evertit, <hi rend="ital">so</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in the manner mentioned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic et nata et progressa eloquentia videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus indignum Sic circumiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic deinceps omne opus contexitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arare mavelim quam sic amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic se res habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic regii constiterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic res Romana in antiquum statum rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ad Alpes perventum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:1:104" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 1, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:46:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 46, 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 32, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 32, 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 49, 201</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:40:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 40, 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 62</bibl>.—Often sic does not qualify the main predicate, but a participle or adjective referring to it: <cit><quote lang="la">sic igitur instructus veniat ad causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sic affectos dimisisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic omnibus copiis fusis se in castra recipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic milites consolatus eodem die reducit in castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.2" n="2" level="3"> In a parenthet. clause (= ita): <cit><quote lang="la">quae, ut sic dicam, ad corpus pertinent civitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>so to speak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:56:168" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 56, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentabar declamitans—sic enim nunc loquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:310" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 90, 310</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 39, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 660</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 597</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 866</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.3" n="3" level="3"> Referring not to <cb n="SIC" /> the predicate, but to some intermediate term understood (= ita; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Engl. so): sic provolant duo Fabii (= sic loquentes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 46, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic enim nostrae rationes postulabant (sic = ut sic agerem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi enim ipsi sic video placere (sic = sic faciendo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic enim concedis mihi proximis litteris (= ut sic agam),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic enim statuerat (= hoc faciendum esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid igitur? Non sic oportet? Equidem censeo sic (sic = hoc fieri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic soleo (i. e. bona consilia reddere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic soleo amicos (i. e. beare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic memini tamen (= hoc ita esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sic audivi (= ita esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic prorsus existimo (= hoc ita esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 33, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam sic cogitis ipsi (= hoc facere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 178</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.4" n="4" level="3"> As completing object, = hoc: <cit><quote lang="la">iis litteris respondebo: sic enim postulas (= hoc postulas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic adsiste. Sic volo (= hoc volo, or hoc te facere volo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic fata jubent (= hoc jubent, or hoc facere jubent),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic apud nos hodie cenes. Sic face,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic faciendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.5" n="5" level="3"> Predicatively with <hi rend="ital">esse</hi> (appellari, videri, etc.), in the sense of talis: <cit><quote lang="la">sic vita hominum est (= talis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir acerrimo ingenio—sic enim fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaris noster—sic est enim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic est vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic, Crito, est hic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: sic sum; <cit><quote lang="la">si placeo, utere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic sententiest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic est (= sic res se habet),</quote> <trans><tr>that is so</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sic sunt (i. e. vivunt) haud multum heredem juvant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc hoc profecto sic est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic est. Non muto sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:14:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 14, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.6" n="6" level="3"> Rarely as subject (mostly representing a subject-clause): <cit><quote lang="la">sic commodius esse arbitror quam manere hanc (sic = abire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sic (= hoc) est factum, erus damno auctus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Quid? Concidit? <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Sic suspicio est (= eam concidisse), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi sic est usus (= sic agere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic opus est (= hoc facere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 279</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 785</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.7" n="B" level="2"> To express relations other than manner (rare). </sense><sense id="n44111.8" n="1" level="3"> Of consequence; <hi rend="ital">un der these circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accordingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic Numitori ad supplicium Remus deditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic et habet quod uterque eorum habuit, et explevit quod utrique defuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 42, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic victam legem esse, nisi caveant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavis mihi ructus est. Sic sine modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44111.9" n="2" level="3"> Of condition; <hi rend="ital">on this condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if this be done</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquas illius anni pestes recordamini, sic enim facillime perspicietis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:25:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 25, 55</bibl></cit>: displiceas aliis; <cit><quote lang="la">sic ego tutus ero (sic = si displicebis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:13:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scironis mediā sic licet ire viā (sic = si amantes eunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit> (3, 16), 12: <cit><quote lang="la">sic demum lucos Stygios Aspicies (= non aspicies, nisi hoc facies),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 154</bibl></cit> (for sic as antecedent of si, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, IV. 5).—</sense><sense id="n44111.10" n="3" level="3"> Of intensity: <cit><quote lang="la">non latuit scintilla ingenii: sic erat in omni sermone sollers (= tam sollers erat ut non lateret ingenium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 21, 37</bibl></cit>;
