cf. infra, IV. 4.</sense><sense id="n44111.11" n="II" level="1"> Referring to a subsequent sentence, <hi rend="ital">thus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as follows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the following manner</hi> (= hoc modo, hoc pacto, hujusmodi, ad hunc modum): <cit><quote lang="la">ingressus est sic loqui Scipio: Catonis hoc senis est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Varro ita exorsus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>): hunc inter pugnas Servilius sic compellat, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 256 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">puero sic dicit pater: Noster esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic faciam: adsimulabo quasi quam culpam in sese admiserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">salem candidum sic facito: amphoram puram impleto, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 88</bibl></cit>: sic enim dixisti: <cit><quote lang="la">Vidi ego tuam lacrimulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res autem se sic habet: composite et apte sine sententiis dicere insania est,</quote> <trans><tr>the truth is this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:236" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 71, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic loquere, sic vive: vide, ne te ulla res deprimat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 10:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 10, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 10:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 77</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 21, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 30</bibl>; Cic. <pb n="1691" /> <cb n="SIC" /> Inv. 1, 39, 71; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 45, 198</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 40, 167</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 40, 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 521</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.12" n="2" level="3"> Esp., with ellipsis of predicate: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sic: diem statuo, etc. (sc. ago),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes sic introduces detached words: sic loqui nosse, judicasse vetant, novisse jubent et judicavisse (=<hi rend="ital">they forbid to say</hi> nosse, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 47, 157</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">For instance</hi> (= hoc modo, hoc pacto, ut hoc, verbi gratiā, ut si; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:49:91 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 49, 91 sq.</bibl> infra): <cit><quote lang="la">disjunctum est, cum unumquodque certo concluditur verbo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 27, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala definitio est ... cum aliquid non grave dicit, sic: Stultitia est immensa gloriae cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:49:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 49, 91</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n44111.14" n="III" level="1"> As a local demonstrative, <hi rend="ital">thus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so</hi>, etc. (<foreign lang="greek">deiktikw=s</foreign>; colloq.; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly comice): ne hunc ornatum vos meum admiremini, quod ego processi sic cum servili schemā,</quote> <trans><tr>as you see me now</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed amictus sic hac ludibundus incessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sic per totam infamis traducerer urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit> (3, 18), 7: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ad me, miserande, redis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 728</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 4</bibl>.—So accompanied with a corresponding gesture: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid tu igitur sic hoc digitulis duobus sumebas primoribus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Quid si curram? <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Censeo. <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> An sic potius placide? (the speaker imitating the motion), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 8, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non licet te sic placidule bellam belle tangere?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non omnia sic poterant conjuncta manere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 441</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Here belong the phrases sic dedero, sic dabo, sic datur, expressing a threat of revenge, or satisfaction at another's misfortune: sic dedero! aere militari tetigero lenunculum,</quote> <trans><tr>I will give it to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic dabo!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doletne? hem, sic datur si quis erum servos spernit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic furi datur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 25</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 46</bibl>.—Referring to an act just performed by the speaker: <cit><quote lang="la">sic deinde quicunque alius transiliet moenia mea (= sic pereat, quicunque deinde, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic eat quaecunque Romana lugebit hostem,</quote> <trans><tr>so will every one fare who</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ... Cetera sit fortis castrorum turba tuorum (= sic ut interfeci te),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 285</bibl></cit>.—So with a <hi rend="ital">comp.-clause</hi> expressed: <cit><quote lang="la">sic stratas legiones Latinorum dabo, quemadmodum legatum jacentem videtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 24, 8</bibl> (v. IV. 1. infra).</sense><sense id="n44111.15" n="IV" level="1"> As correlative, with, 1. A comparative clause (sic far more frequent than ita); 2. A contrasted clause, mostly with <hi rend="ital">ut;</hi> 3. A modal clause, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (ita more freq. than sic); 4. A clause expressing intensity, introduced by <hi rend="ital">ut;</hi> 5. A conditional clause (rare; ita more freq.); 6. With a reason, introduced by <hi rend="ital">quia</hi> (ante-class. and very rare); 7. With an inf. clause; 8. With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, expressing purpose or result. </sense><sense id="n44111.16" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">comp. clauses</hi>, usu. introduced by <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, but also by <hi rend="ital">quemadmodum</hi> (very freq.), <hi rend="ital">sicut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">velut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tamquam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quomodo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> (rare and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">ceu</hi> (rare; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.), <hi rend="ital">quantus</hi> (rare and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">qualis</hi> (ante-class. and rare). </sense><sense id="n44111.17" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cibi satietas subamara aliquā re relevatur, sic animus defessus audiendi admiratione redintegratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:17:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non omnem frugem, neque arborem in omni agro reperire possis, sic non omne facinus in omni vitā nascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex suo regno sic Mithridates profugit ut ex eodem Ponto Medea quondam profugisse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tu nunc de Coriolano, sic Clitarchus de Themistocle finxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 11, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic moneo ut filium, sic faveo ut mihi, sic hortor ut et pro patriā et amicissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vitā, sic oratione durus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 31, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Lentulo sic fero ut debeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic est ut narro tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 8, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:30:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 30, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 153</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 51, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52:7" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 52, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 495</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 539</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 165</bibl> et saep.—So in the formula ut quisque ... sic (more freq. ita), rendered by <hi rend="ital">according as</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the more ... the ...</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque rem accurat suam, sic ei procedunt postprincipia denique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quaeque res est tur pissima, sic maxime et maturissime vindicanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; v. Fischer, Gr. II. p. 751.—</sense><sense id="n44111.18" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quemadmodum</hi>: quemadmodum tibicen sine tibiis canere, sic orator, nisi multitudine audiente, eloquens <cb n="SIC" /> esse non potest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:83:338" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 83, 338</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum se tribuni gessissent in prohibendo dilectu, sic patres in lege prohibenda gerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic vestras hallucinationes fero, quemadmodum Juppiter ineptias poëtarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 26:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 26, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:23:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 23, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 27, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:52:200" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 52, 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5, 6</bibl> (bis); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clem. 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 23:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 23, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.19" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">sicut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum simul, sicut ego pro multis, sic ille pro Appio dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:230" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 64, 230</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">46, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:44:186" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 44, 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 57, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 9, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.20" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">velut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut ipse in re trepidā se sit tutatus, sic consulem loca tutiora castris cepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 41, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 375</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 705</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">tamquam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam litteris in cerā, sic se ajebat imaginibus quae meminisse vellet, perscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:88:360" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 88, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid autem ego sic adhuc egi, tamquam integra sit causa patriciorum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic Ephesi fui, tamquam domi meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:69:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 69, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:42:180" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 42, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">58, 213</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">66, 235</bibl>; 74, 258; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 12, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101, 7</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus innocentiae sic in hac calamitosā famā, quasi in aliquā perniciosissimā flammā subvenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea sic observabo quasi intercalatum non sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid tu me sic salutas quasi dudum non videris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:11:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 11, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 8, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sic vivam quasi sciam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 20:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quomodo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo nomen in militiam non daret debilis, sic ad iter quod inhabile sciat, non accedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. Sap. 3</bibl></cit> (30), 4: <cit><quote lang="la">sic demus quomodo vellemus accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 9, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ot. Sap. 6, 2</bibl> (32 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>); Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 4</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ceu</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceu cetera nusquam Bella forent ... sic Martem indomitum Cernimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 438</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sic incerto mutantur flamine Syrtes, quam cito femineā non constat foedus in irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 281</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quantus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sic errore laetatus Ulixes ... nec sic Electra ... quanta ego collegi gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit> (3, 6), 5 sqq.—（<foreign lang="greek">l</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">qualis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imo sic condignum donum quali'st quoi dono datum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 40</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">m</foreign>) Without a correlative particle, in an independent sentence: <cit><quote lang="la">Quis potione uti aut cibo dulci diutius potest? sic omnibus in rebus voluptatibus maximis fastidium finitimum est (= ut nemo cibo dulci uti diutius potest, sic, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:25:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 25, 100</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.21" n="2" level="3"> In contrasted clauses, mostly with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, which may generally be rendered <hi rend="ital">while</hi>: ut ad bella suscipienda Gallorum acer ac promptus est animus, sic mollis ad calamitates perferendas mens eorum est (almost = etsi ad bella suscipienda ... tamen mollis est, etc., <hi rend="ital">while</hi>, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19</bibl>: a ceteris oblectationibus ut deseror, sic litteris sustentor et recreor, <hi rend="ital">while I am deserted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I am sustained</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 10, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 57, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 131</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 76</bibl>.—So freq. two members of the same sentence are coordinated by <hi rend="ital">ut... sic</hi> (ita) with almost the same force as a co-ordination by <hi rend="ital">cum ... tum</hi>, or by <hi rend="ital">sed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul, ut fortasse vere, sic parum utiliter in praesens certamen respondit (= vere fortasse, sed parum utiliter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nondum satis claram victoriam, sic prosperae spei pugnam imber diremit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 32, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(forma erat) ut non cygnorum, sic albis proxima cygnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 509</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 38, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 370</bibl>.—In this use <hi rend="ital">etiam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quoque</hi> is sometimes joined with sic (never by Cic. with ita): <cit><quote lang="la">nostri sensus, ut in pace semper, sic tum etiam in bello congruebant (= cum ... tum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sunt, sic etiam nominantur senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam ut culpam, sic etiam suspitionem vitare potuisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut superiorum aetatum studia occidunt, sic occidunt etiam senectutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 20, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut voce, sic etiam oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 25, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:15:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 15, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:25:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 25, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 19</bibl>.—More rarely with <hi rend="ital">quem ad modum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quomodo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quem ad modum est, sic etiam appelletur tyrannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo modo ad bene vivendum, sic etiam ad beate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:17:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 17, 37</bibl></cit>. <cb n="SIC" /> —</sense><sense id="n44111.22" n="3" level="3"> With a clause of <hi rend="ital">manner</hi> introduced by <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> = <hi rend="ital">so that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic fuimus semper comparati ut hominum sermonibus quasi in aliquod judicium vocaremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam sic audio ut Plautum mihi aut Naevium videar audire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic agam vobiscum ut aliquid de vestris vitiis audiatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia sic suppetunt ut ei nullam deesse virtutem oratoris putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:71:250" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 71, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis pars orationis esse debet laudabilis, sic ut verbum nullum excidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic tecum agam ut vel respondendi vel interpellandi potestatem faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero sic erat umquam non paratus Milo contra illum ut non satis fere esset paratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic eum eo de re publicā disputavit ut sentiret sibi cum viro forti esse pugnandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 245</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 22, 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">40, 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:40:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 40, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 10, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:21:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 21, 5</bibl>.—Sometimes the correlative clause is restrictive, and sic = <hi rend="ital">but so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yet so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">only so</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi sic placuit ut cetera Antisthenis, hominis acuti magis quam eruditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic conveniet reprehendi, ut demonstretur etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:46:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 46, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 11, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 3, 1</bibl> (ita is more freq. in this sense).—</sense><sense id="n44111.23" n="4" level="3"> With a clause expressing <hi rend="ital">intensity</hi> (so both with adjj. and verbs; but far less freq. than ita, tam, adeo), <hi rend="ital">to such a degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so far</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ego illum in timorem dabo, ipse sese ut neget esse eum qui siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:20 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 20 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conficior lacrimis sic ut ferre non possim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic rem fuisse apertam ut judicium fieri nihil attinuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:28:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 28, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus responso judices sic exarserunt ut capitis hominem innocentissimum condemnarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:54:233" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 54, 233</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:302" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 88, 302</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:53:177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 53, 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">55, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 21, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 36, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.24" n="5" level="3"> Rarely <hi rend="ital">conditional</hi> clauses have the antecedent sic. </sense><sense id="n44111.25" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose, to represent the result of the condition as sure: <cit><quote lang="la">sic invidiam effugies, si te non ingesseris oculis, si bona tua non jactaveris, si scieris in sinu gaudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 105:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 105, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic hodie veniet si qua negavit heri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit> (3, 6), 20.— </sense><sense id="n44111.26" n="b" level="4"> Denoting <hi rend="ital">with the proviso that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but only if</hi> (usu. ita): <cit><quote lang="la">decreverunt ut cum populus regem jussisset, id sic ratum esset si patres auctores fuissent,</quote> <trans><tr>that the choice should be valid</tr>, <tr>but only if the Senate should ratify it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ignovisse putato Me tibi si cenes hodie mecum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 69</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44111.27" n="6" level="3"> Sic quia = idcirco quia (very rare): <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Quid vos? Insanin' estis? <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Quīdum? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Sic quia foris ambulatis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.28" n="7" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. clause</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">sic igitur sentio, naturam primum atque ingenium ad dicendum vim afferre maximam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:25:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 25, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic a majoribus nostris accepimus, praetorem quaestori suo parentis loco esse oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:19:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sic existimo, in summo imperatore quattuor res inesse oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:55:167" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 55, 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 93</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 28, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:36:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 36, 138</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">41, 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15, 11</bibl>.—Esp., after sic habeto (habe, habeas) = scito (only Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">sic habeto, in eum statum tuum reditum incidere ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 3</bibl>; 2, 6, 5; 2, 10, 1; 7, 18, 1; 9, 16, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 20, 1</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n44111.29" n="8" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, expressing purpose or result: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc sic faciam, sic consilium est, ad erum ut veniam docte atque astu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Ariobarzane sic contendi ut talenta, quae mihi pollicebatur, illi daret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic accidit ut ex tanto navium numero nulla omnino navis ... desideraretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:67:271" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 67, 271</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n44111.30" n="V" level="1"> Idiomatic usages of sic. </sense><sense id="n44111.31" n="1" level="3"> In a wish, expressed as a conclusion after an imperative (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">parce: sic bene sub tenerā parva quiescat humo (= si parces, bene quiescat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annue: sic tibi sint intonsi, Phoebe, capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone, precor, fastus ... Sic tibi nec vernum nascentia frigus adurat Poma, nec excutiant rapidi florentia venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 762</bibl></cit>: dic <pb n="1692" /> <cb n="SIC" /> mihi de nostrā quae sentis vera puellā: <cit><quote lang="la">Sic tibi sint dominae, Lygdame, dempta juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:5:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 30</bibl>.—The imperative may follow the clause with sic: <cit><quote lang="la">sic tua Cyrneas fugiant examina taxos ... Incipe (sc. cantare) si quid habes (= si incipies cantare, opto tibi ut tua examina, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic tibi (Arethusa) Doris amara suam non intermisceat undam: Incipe (= si incipies, opto tibi ut Doris, etc.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic mare compositum, sic sit tibi piscis in undā Credulus ... Dic ubi sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 857</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 702" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 702</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic te Diva potens Cypri ... Ventorumque regat pater, Navis ... Reddas incolumem Vergilium (= si tu, navis, reddes Vergilium, prosperum precor tibi cursum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: sic venias hodierne: tibi dem turis honores (=si venies, tibi dem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:53" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 135</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 148</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.32" n="2" level="3"> Sic (like ita) with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> in strong asseveration (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sic me di amabunt, ut me tuarum miseritum'st fortunarum (= by the love of the gods, I pity, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diespiter me sic amabit ut ego hanc familiam interire cupio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic has deus aequoris artes Adjuvet, ut nemo jamdudum littore in isto constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:866" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 866</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic mihi te referas levis, ut non altera nostro limine intulit ulla pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 15</bibl> (4, 14), 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vera cano, sic usque sacras innoxia laurus vescar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:63" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.33" n="3" level="3"> In a demonstrative temporal force, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ou(/tws</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as the matter stands now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as it now is</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as it then was</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n44111.34" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">e Graecis cavendae sunt quaedam familiaritates, praeter hominum perpaucorum, si qui sunt vetere Graeciā digni. Sic vero fallaces sunt permulti et leves,</quote> <trans><tr>but as things now stand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at sic citius quī te expedias his aerumnis reperias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Pol tibi istuc credo nomen actutum fore. <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Dum interea sic sit, istuc actutum sino, <hi rend="ital">provided it be as it is</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens hoc tibi ego interdixi, meam ne sic volgo pollicitarere operam,</quote> <trans><tr>thus</tr>, <tr>as you are doing now</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si utrumvis tibi visus essem, Non sic ludibrio tuis factis habitus essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sic nudos in flumen deicere (voluerunt),</quote> <trans><tr>naked</tr>, <tr>as they are</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub altā platano ... jacentes sic temere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 14</bibl></cit>.—Esp., with <hi rend="ital">sine</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">me germanam meam sororem tibi sic sine dote dedisse,</quote> <trans><tr>so as she is</tr>, <tr>without a dowry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic sine malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at operam perire meam sic ... perpeti nequeo,</quote> <trans><tr>without result</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 34</bibl></cit> Ritschl, Fleck. (Brix omits sic): nec sic de nihilo fulminis ira cadit (= <hi rend="ital">without cause</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl> (3, 8), 52: mirabar hoc si sic abiret, <hi rend="ital">so</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">without trouble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc non poterit sic abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sic abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 39</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n44111.35" n="(b)" level="5"> With imperatives, esp. with <hi rend="ital">sine</hi>: Quid ego hoc faciam postea? sic sine eumpse, <hi rend="ital">just let him alone</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">leave him as he is</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 4, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non vult (numerare), sic sine adstet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine fores sic, abi,</quote> <trans><tr>let the door alone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 62</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n44111.36" n="(g)" level="5"> Pregn., implying a concession (= <foreign lang="greek">kai\ ou(/tws</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">even as it is now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even without doing so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in spite of it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo bis iterare, sat sic longae fiunt fabulae,</quote> <trans><tr>narratives are long enough anyhow</tr>, <tr>as they are</tr>, <tr>without saying them twice over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed sic quoque erat tamen Acis,</quote> <trans><tr>even as it was</tr>, <tr>in spite of what has been said</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:896" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 896</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sic quoque fallebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:698" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed sic me et libertatis fructu privas et diligentiae,</quote> <trans><tr>anyhow</tr>, <tr>not taking into account what is mentioned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: exhibeas molestiam si quid debeam, qui nunc sic tam es molestus, <hi rend="ital">who art so troublesome even as it is</hi>, i. e. without my owing you any thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic quoque parte plebis affectā, fides tamen publica potior senatui fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:642" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 642</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.37" n="4" level="3"> Ellipt., referring to something in the mind of the speaker: <cit><quote lang="la">Quod si hoc nunc sic incipiam? Nihil est. Quod si sic? Tantumdem egero. At sic opinor? Non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: illa quae aliis sic, aliis secus videntur, <hi rend="ital">to some in one way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to others in another</hi> (= aliis aliter), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:17:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 17, 47</bibl>: Quid vini absumpsit! Sic hoc dicens, asperum hoc est, aliud lenius, = <hi rend="ital">this wine is so</hi> (the speaker<cb n="SICC" />  not saying what he thinks of it), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 49</bibl>: deinde quod illa (quae ego dixi) sive faceta sunt, sive sic, fiunt narrante te venustissima, <hi rend="ital">or so</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">or otherwise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monitorem non desiderabit qui dicat, Sic incede, sic cena ... sic amico utere, sic cive, sic socio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44111.38" n="5" level="3"> In answers, <hi rend="ital">yes</hi> = the French, Italian, and Spanish <hi rend="ital">si</hi> (ante - class. and rare): <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Phaniam relictam ais? <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Sic, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 2</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Illa maneat? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Sic, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 30</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Sicine est sententia? <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Sic, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sica: <entryFree id="n44112" type="main" key="si_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n44112.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A curved dagger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a poniard</hi>, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=336" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 336</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 496 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:16:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:12 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 12 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum haec cottidiana, sicae, veneni, peculatus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>for stabbing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc sicae, hinc venena, hinc falsa testamenta nascuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 8, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44112.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the edge</hi> of a boar's tusk: <cit><quote lang="la">cum arbore et saxo apri exacuant dentium sicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">wit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicam ingenii destringentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sicambri: <entryFree id="n44113" type="main" key="Si^cambri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcambri</orth>, v. Sigambri.</entryFree>
sicani: <entryFree id="n44114" type="main" key="Si^ca_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*si=ka^noi/</foreign>, <sense id="n44114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient people of Italy on the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a portion of whom afterwards migrated to Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 293</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 795</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 317</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:34" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 34</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n44114.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcānus</orth> (scanned Sīcănŭs, in analogy with the Greek, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:314" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 314</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:258" default="NO">14, 258</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sīcānŭs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Griph. 46</bibl></cit>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sikano/s</foreign>. * </sense><sense id="n44114.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> Sicani, <hi rend="ital">Sicanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes, i. q. Sicani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 328</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n44114.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Siculian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sicilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:32" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:314" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:258" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medimna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Griph. 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44114.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīcănĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sika/nios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Sicanian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Siculian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sicilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:46:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 46, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:9:8" default="NO">11, 9, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44114.5" n="2" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sī-cănĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sikani/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the island of Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 464</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 495</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 724</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicilia, Sicania, a Thucydide dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 86</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n44114.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīcănis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sicanian</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">Siculian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sicilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:600" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 600</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sicarius: <entryFree id="n44115" type="main" key="si_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīcārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sica</etym>, <sense id="n44115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assassin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderer</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">percussor, homicida): per abusionem sicarios etiam omnes vocamus, qui caedem telo quocumque commiserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 39</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam sexcenti sunt, qui inter sicarios et de veneficiis accusabant,</quote> <trans><tr>of assassination</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 90</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio inter sicarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:53:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 53, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 54</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">inter sicarios defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex Cornelia (Sullae) de sicariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:18:section=5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 18, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege de sicariis condemnari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Orell. Ind. Legum, in his edit. of Cic., vol. viii. 3, p. 162: in exercendā de sicariis quaestione, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sicca: <entryFree id="n44116" type="main" key="Sicca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sicca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a border-town on the east of Numidia</hi>, with a temple of Venus, now <hi rend="ital">Kef</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 3, 2, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 15</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Siccenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sicca</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 4 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
siccabilis: <entryFree id="n44117" type="hapax" key="sicca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siccābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sicco</etym>, <sense id="n44117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that makes dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:138 sq" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 138 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
siccaneus: <entryFree id="n44118" type="main" key="sicca_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siccānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>siccus</etym> (a technical word of Columella); of soil, <sense id="n44118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a dry nature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus prati (opp. riguum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:16:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus (opp. riguus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 30, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:71" default="NO">11, 2, 71</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de siccaneis et riguis non comperimus,</quote> <trans><tr>dry places</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
siccanus: <entryFree id="n44119" type="main" key="sicca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siccānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> (a technical word of the elder Pliny); of plants, <sense id="n44119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a dry nature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmi (opp. riguae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 17, 29, § 72</bibl></cit>: olus, Pelag. Vet. 7.</sense></entryFree>
siccarius: <entryFree id="n44120" type="gloss" key="sicca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siccārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for drying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keeping dry</hi>: canistra, <hi rend="ital">stands for wine-cups</hi> (used for keeping the table or the clothes from being wet), acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 706</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
siccatio: <entryFree id="n44121" type="hapax" key="sicca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siccātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sicco</etym>, <sense id="n44121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 33, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 26, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
siccativus: <entryFree id="n44122" type="hapax" key="sicca_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siccātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that makes dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">siccative</hi>: malagma, <cb n="SICC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:71" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 71</bibl>: aquae, Casslod. Var. 10, 29.</sense></entryFree>
siccatorius:
<entryFree id="n44123" type="hapax" key="sicca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siccātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sicco</etym>, <sense id="n44123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that makes dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">origanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> Diaet. 10</bibl></cit>.
(</sense><sense id="n44123.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sicce</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, a false read. for sic, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 12</bibl>.)</sense></entryFree>
sicce: <entryFree id="n44124" type="main" key="sicce_" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siccē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. siccus <sense id="n44124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
siccenses: <entryFree id="n44125" type="main" key="Siccenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Siccenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. Sicca.</entryFree>
siccesco: <entryFree id="n44126" type="main" key="siccesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siccesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n44126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [siccus], <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi> (not anteAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 339</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
siccificus: <entryFree id="n44127" type="hapax" key="sicci^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siccĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>siccus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n44127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that makes dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis aeris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
siccine: <entryFree id="n44128" type="main" key="sicci^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siccĭnē</orth>, v. sicine.</entryFree>
siccitas: <entryFree id="n44129" type="main" key="sicci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siccĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n44129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> siccitatium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 222</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>siccus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">dryness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">siccity</hi> (freq. and class.; used alike in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n44129.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44129.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: ab lippitudine usque siccitas ut sit tibi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44129.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44129.4" n="1" level="3"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">dryness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Sipontinā siccitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:27:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 27, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccitates paludum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44129.5" n="2" level="3"> Of the weather, <hi rend="ital">dryness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drought</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccitate et inopiā frugum insignis annus fuit: sex menses numquam pluisse, memoriae proditum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 4, 28, § 51</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum in Galliā propter siccitates angustius provenerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in siccitatibus acutae febres oriuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 44, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 65, 85, § 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:50" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 4, 28, § 50</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44129.6" n="3" level="3"> Of the human body, <hi rend="ital">dryness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">siccity</hi>, as a state of health; <hi rend="ital">freedom from gross humors</hi> (opp. rheum, catarrh, tumefaction, etc.), <hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solidity</hi>: Persae eam sunt consecuti corporis siccitatem, ut neque spuerent neque emungerentur suffiatoque corpore essent, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 395, 7</bibl>: adde siccitatem, quae consequitur hanc continentiam in victu; <cit><quote lang="la">adde integritatem valetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 10, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44129.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dryness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jejuneness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want of ornament</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">isti (magistri) cum non modo dominos se fontium, sed se ipsos fontes esse dicant, et omnium rigare debeant ingenia, non putant fore ridiculum, si, cum id polliceantur aliis, arescant ipsi siccitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis siccitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunitatem et siccitatem et inopiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:285" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 82, 285</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sicco: <entryFree id="n44130" type="main" key="sicco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sicco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n44130.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dry up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44130.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">venti et sol siccare prius confidunt omnia posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 390</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sol siccaverat herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccabat rorantes capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sole capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:770" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 770</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 55, § 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:46:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 46, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 13, 27, § 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad lunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 11, 36, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lina madentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:931" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 931</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retia litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:362" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veste cruores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 19, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 469</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 395</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:509" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 509</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocis lacrimas siccare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:6 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 6 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem sudario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:148" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44130.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n44130.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To dry up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drain</hi> land, marshes, springs, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">paludes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">paludem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:690" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 690</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">palustria aestate siccantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 22, 48, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri siccati,</quote> <trans><tr>drained lands</tr>, <tr>lands uncovered by draining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea Sidereo siccata sitim collegit ab aestu,</quote> <trans><tr>parched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 341</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44130.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To exhaust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drain dry</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ovis ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 42</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">distenta ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:46" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 46</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, transf.: distentas siccant pecudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 314</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">siccata ovis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>milked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calices,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to drain</tr>, <tr>empty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 68</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so. cadis siccatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 35, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: cum siccare sacram largo Permessida posset Ore, <hi rend="ital">to drink deeply from the fountain of the Muses</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be a great poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:70:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 70, 3</bibl>.—In Gr. construction: <cit><quote lang="la">Arethusa virides manu siccata capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 575</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44130.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To dry up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heal up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remore</hi> an unwholesome humor; or, <hi rend="ital">to heal up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi> some part of the body from an unwholesome humor (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in the elder Pliny): ad pituitam oris siccandam. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 13, § 17</bibl>: suppurata, <pb n="1693" /> <cb n="SICC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 17, 28, § 133</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">strumas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 4, 6, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 6, 33, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arterias umidas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 14, 53, § 148</bibl></cit>; cf.: corpus pilā, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to strengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invigorate</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 394, 29</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. siccitas, I. B. 3.: vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 187</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fluminis undam Vulnera siccabat lymphis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:834" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 834</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, in a Gr. construction: juvenes siccati vulnera lymphis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:527" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 527</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44130.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get dry</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens flumina et stagna siccaverint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: tundis cuminum et postea infundis in aceto; <cit><quote lang="la">cum siccaverit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:3:18:section=105" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 3, 18, § 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2:section=132 al" default="NO">4, 2, § 132 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi pluerit et siccaverit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 112, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
siccoculus: <entryFree id="n44131" type="hapax" key="sicco^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siccŏcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>siccus-oculus</etym>, <sense id="n44131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having dry eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dry-eyed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus nostrum semper siccoculum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
siccus: <entryFree id="n44132" type="main" key="siccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siccus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf.
