Sanscr. cush, to dry up; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">au)/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n44132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dry.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44132.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44132.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aridus): arena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces fluminum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccāque in rupe resedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccum et sine umore ullo solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:55" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit> (3, 6), 11: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via (opp. palustris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:8:2:section=32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 8, 2, § 32</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horreum siccissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>tearless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 18</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:66" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:1044" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 1044</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 80; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurrere pedibus super aequora siccis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 50</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, transf.: siccus aerumnas tuli,</quote> <trans><tr>tearless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1270" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:18" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <trans><tr>dry bread</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 68, § 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agaricum manducatum siccum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 7, 18, § 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia non sanguine sicca suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 12: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:383" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 50" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 50</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicci stimulabant sanguinis enses,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bloodless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:213" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinae,</quote> <trans><tr>standing dry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna minorque ferae (i. e. ursa major et minor), utraque sicca,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that do not dip into</tr>, <tr>set beneath the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:9:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>snow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <trans><tr>dried up with heat</tr>, <tr>husky</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 278</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n44132.3" n="2" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">siccum</orth>, i; and <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sicca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">dry land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dry place; dry places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec rostra tenent siccum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sicco,</quote> <trans><tr>on the dry land</tr>, <tr>on the shore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit> (9), 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 363</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 7, 22, § 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aqua piscibus, ut sicca terrenis, circumfusus nobis spiritus volucribus convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo, quae in siccis provenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 165</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in siccis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 170</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44132.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44132.5" n="1" level="3"> Of the weather, <hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without rain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive annus siccus est ... seu pluvius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:20:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestivi tempora sicca Canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: incipit et sicco fervere terra Cane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit> (3, 24), 4: <cit><quote lang="la">sole dies referente siccos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccis aër fervoribus ustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 31, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 47, 48, § 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit> (3, 9), 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 8, § 57</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without rain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemps,</quote> <trans><tr>without snow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44132.6" n="2" level="3"> Of the human body, <hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, as a healthy state (opp. rheumy, catarrhal, tumid, etc.), <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mulier) sicca, succida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 192</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora sicciora cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora graciliora siccioraque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(puella) Nec bello pede ... nec ore sicco,</quote> <trans><tr>free from saliva</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 43, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tussis,</quote> <trans><tr>without expectoration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>causing dryness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 71" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 71</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44132.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thirsty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis diu sicci sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">siti sicca sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faucibus siccis,</quote> <trans><tr>fasting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 358</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44132.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">abstemious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sober</hi> (syn. sobrius): <hi rend="ital">Art.</hi> Ego praeter alios meum virum fui rata Siccum, frugi, continentem, etc. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> At nunc dehinc scito, illum ante omnes ... Madidum, nihili, incontinentem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 7</bibl>; so (opp. vinolentus) <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 395, 4</bibl> (opp. vinolenti); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 281</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 5</bibl>, <cb n="SICI" /> 39: <cit><quote lang="la">siccis omnia dura deus proposuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44132.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44132.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solid</hi> (acc. to I. B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">(Attici) sani duntaxat et sicci habeantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil erat in ejus oratione nisi sincerum, nihil nisi siccum atque sanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:202" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 55, 202</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44132.11" n="2" level="3"> Of style, <hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insipid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jejune</hi> (acc. to I. B. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">siccum et sollicitum et contractum dicendi propositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicca et incondita et propemodum jejuna oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:32" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durus et siccus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sicci omnino atque aridi pueri rhetoribus traderentur,</quote> <trans><tr>ignorant</tr>, <tr>unformed</tr>, <tr>unprepared</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44132.12" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medullae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>void of love</tr>, <tr>cold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit> (3, 3), 17; so, <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 686</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:81:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 81, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:17:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 17, 8</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">siccē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">dryly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without wet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">damp</hi> (very rare; perh. only in the two foll. passages). </sense><sense id="n44132.13" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut bos sicce stabuletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44132.14" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos solos Attice dicere, id est quasi sicce et integre,</quote> <trans><tr>firmly</tr>, <tr>solidly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, II.</sense></entryFree>
sicelicon: <entryFree id="n44133" type="greek" key="si^ce^li^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭcĕlĭcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sikeliko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n44133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> psyllion, <hi rend="ital">fleawort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleabane</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 90, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sicelis: <entryFree id="n44134" type="main" key="Si_ce^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīcĕlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Siculi, D.</entryFree>
sicelisso: <entryFree id="n44135" type="main" key="si^ce^lisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭcĕlisso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. sicilisso.</entryFree>
sicera: <entryFree id="n44136" type="greek" key="si_ce^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīcĕra</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">si/kera</foreign> [from the Heb. <foreign />], <sense id="n44136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of spirituous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intoxicating drink</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> adv. Psych. 9</bibl>, from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 52, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 3, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sichaeus: <entryFree id="n44137" type="main" key="Si^chaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭchaeus</orth>, v. Sychaeus.</entryFree>
sicilia: <entryFree id="n44138" type="main" key="Si^ci^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Siculi, B.</entryFree>
sicilicula: <entryFree id="n44139" type="hapax" key="si_ci_li^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīcīlĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sicilis</etym>, <sense id="n44139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cutting instrument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small sickle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sicilicus: <entryFree id="n44140" type="main" key="si_ci_li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīcīlĭcus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sīcīlĭquus</orth>, and in inscrr. also designated by <figure />, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2537</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n44140.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44140.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the fourth part of an</hi> uncia, and consequently <hi rend="ital">the forty-eight part of an</hi> as: <cit><quote lang="la">cum noverca universae hereditatis habeat dodrantem semunciam et sicilicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:21:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 1, 21, § 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44140.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44140.3" n="a" level="4"> As a measure of length, <hi rend="ital">a quarter of an inch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 28" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 29, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:57" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 6, 31, § 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44140.4" n="b" level="4"> As a measure of land, <hi rend="ital">one forty-eighth of a</hi> jugerum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:5" default="NO">5, 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44140.5" n="c" level="4"> As a weight, <hi rend="ital">two drachms</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rhem. Fan.</author> Pond. 20</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44140.6" n="d" level="4"> As a measure of time, <hi rend="ital">the forty-eighth part of an hour</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 32, 75, § 325</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44140.7" n="e" level="4"> As a copper coin, <hi rend="ital">two drachms</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2854</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44140.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (from the figure of the sicilicus; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), in the later grammarians, <hi rend="ital">a comma</hi>, Mar. Vict. p. 2467 P.— Also as a sign of the doubling of consonants (as, An'ius, Lucul'us, Mem'ius, sel'a, ser'a, as'eres), Mar. Vict. p. 2456 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
siciliensis: <entryFree id="n44141" type="main" key="Si^ci^li^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcĭlĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Siculi, C.</entryFree>
sicilimenta: <entryFree id="n44142" type="hapax" key="si_ci_li_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīcīlīmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sicilis</etym>, <sense id="n44142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">what is cut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mown with the sickle</hi> (sc. after the first crop has been taken off), <hi rend="ital">the aftermath</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sicilio: <entryFree id="n44143" type="main" key="si_ci_li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīcīlĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mow with the sickle</hi>, after the first crop has been taken off: <cit><quote lang="la">prata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:49:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 49, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:22:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 259</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sicilis: <entryFree id="n44144" type="main" key="si_ci_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīcīlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sica</etym>, <sense id="n44144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting instrument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sickle</hi> (cf. falx): incedit veles vulgo sicilibus latis, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=337" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 337</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 499 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sicilis similitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sicilisso: <entryFree id="n44145" type="hapax" key="si^ci^lisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭcĭlisso</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭcĕlisso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Siculi</etym>, <sense id="n44145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to imitate Sicilian manners</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc argumentum graecissat: tamen Non atticissat, verum sicelissat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 8</bibl></cit>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
sicimina: <entryFree id="n44146" type="main" key="Sicimina"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sicimina</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n44146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sicine: <entryFree id="n44147" type="main" key="si_ci^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīcĭnē</orth> (less correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">siccĭne</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>sice, orig. form of sic, q. v., and the interrog. particle ne</etym>, <sense id="n44147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thus;</hi> in interrog. and exclamatory sentences always beginning the sentence (once in Cic.; twice in Liv.; not in Cæs. or Sall.; freq. in the comic writers; sometimes in the other poets). Like sic, it refers either to a previous statement, or <foreign lang="greek">deiktikw=s</foreign> to something pointed out by the speaker (cf. sic, I. and III.). It almost always implies reproach; sometimes self-reproach (v. infra, 3.). </sense><sense id="n44147.1" n="1" level="3"> Referring to a previous statement: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicine mi abs te refertur gratia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 101</bibl></cit>: <cb n="SICU" /> Sicine me spernis? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicine agis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicine hunc decipis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicine tu eum, cui tu in consilio fuisses ... in discrimen vocavisti?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 33, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicine vestrum militem sinitis vexari ab inimicis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—So in oblique discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">Rogitansque, sicine pugnaturos milites spopondisset?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:134" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:77:3" default="NO" valid="yes">77, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:25" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 25</bibl>.—Rarely used predicatively: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicine est sententia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 114</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44147.2" n="2" level="3"> Referring to something pointed out: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicine hic cum uvidā veste grassabimur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicine, lente, jaces?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit> (2, 15), 8; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 180</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44147.3" n="3" level="3"> Sometimes it introduces exclamatory infinitive clauses: Sicine mi esse os oblĭtum, <hi rend="ital">O that my face</hi> (<hi rend="ital">eyes</hi>) <hi rend="ital">should have been thus covered</hi> (<hi rend="ital">blinded</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicine me atque illam operā tuā nunc miseros sollicitarier!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44147.4" n="4" level="3"> Very rarely without implying reproach: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicine eam incomptis vidisti flere capillis?</quote> <trans><tr>did you see her weep just as she was</tr>, <tr>with unkempt hair?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit> (3, 6), 9 (cf. sic, V. 3.).</sense></entryFree>
sicinius: <entryFree id="n44148" type="main" key="Sicini^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sicinĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n44148.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Sicinius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:263" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 76, 263</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n44148.2" n="II" level="1"> Cn. Sicinius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:216" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 60, 216</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
sicinnista: <entryFree id="n44149" type="greek" key="si^cinnista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭcinnista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sikinnisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who performs the</hi> sicinnis (a dance of Satyrs), <hi rend="ital">a sicinnis-dancer</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:3:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 3, 1 sq.</bibl>, where Gellius calls the dance itself sicinnium (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">si/kinnis</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
sicinnium: <entryFree id="n44150" type="main" key="si^cinni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭcinnĭum</orth>, v. sicinnista.</entryFree>
siclus: <entryFree id="n44151" type="foreign" key="siclus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siclus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Heb. <foreign /></etym>, <sense id="n44151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shekel</hi> (a Hebrew coin), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ezech. 1, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:21:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 21, 32</bibl> et saep.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 25, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sicoris: <entryFree id="n44152" type="main" key="Si^co^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcŏris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tributary of the Iberus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Ilerda</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, now <hi rend="ital">Segre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:14 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 14 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:130" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:335" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 335</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 25, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sicubi: <entryFree id="n44153" type="main" key="si_cu^bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīcŭbi</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>si-ubi; cf. sicunde, from si-unde</etym>, <sense id="n44153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">if in any place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if anywhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheresoever</hi> (rare but class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicubi nactus eris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicubi inciderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicubi aderit Gellius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:51:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 51, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicubi est certamen, scutis magis quam gladiis geritur res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicubi loco cessum, si terga data hosti, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicubi artiora erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi est igitur exceptum foedere Gaditano? etc. ... Nusquam. Ac sicubi esset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicubi magna Jovis antiquo robore quercus Ingentes tendat ramos, aut sicubi nigrum Ilicibus crebris sacrā nemus accubet umbrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:332 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 332 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicubi dimicarent (gladiatores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicubi clarorum virorum sepulcra cognosceret, inferias Manibus dabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per litora passim Diffugiunt, silvasque, et sicubi concava furtim Saxa, petunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 677</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 410</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sicula: <entryFree id="n44154" type="hapax" key="si_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sica</etym>, <sense id="n44154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little dagger;</hi> transf., = membrum virile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
siculi: <entryFree id="n44155" type="main" key="Si^cu^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sikeloi/</foreign>. <sense id="n44155.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Siculians</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Sicilians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ancient Italian people on the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a portion of whom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">driven thence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">migrated to the island of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which derived its name from them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 5, 10, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=101" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 101</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl>.—Hence, in the class. per., </sense><sense id="n44155.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The inhabitants of Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 12, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 12, 1 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi> Siculūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 642</bibl>.—In the <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Sicilian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:13:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 13, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 280</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44155.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sicilian</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Sicily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:14" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>; 4, 4, 44; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 696</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:16:14" default="NO">3, 16, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or, 69, 230</bibl></cit>: Epicharmus, Hor. Ep. <pb n="1694" /> <cb n="SICU" /> 2, 1, 58: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta Empedocles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> A. P. 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Phalaris</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 58</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, juvencus,</quote> <trans><tr>the bull of Phalaris</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:39" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aula,</quote> <trans><tr>the court of Phalaris</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:486" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga,</quote> <trans><tr>the flight of Sex. Pompeius before Octavius after the naval battle near the Sicilian coast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, pirata,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Sex. Pompeius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 422</bibl></cit>: conjux, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Proserpine</hi> (so called because carried off from Sicily), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a Siren</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, cantus,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Sirens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:150" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">logei, Attici omnes: nullum Siculum acceperis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>provincial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44155.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sikeli/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the island of Sicily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum Siciliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:14" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:204" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 88, 90, § 204</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 6, § 12</bibl> et saep. al.—</sense><sense id="n44155.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcĭlĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sicilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes,</quote> <trans><tr>from Sicily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestura mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <trans><tr>the quœstorship in Sicily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:92:318" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 92, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">22: peregrinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44155.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīcĕ-lis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sileli/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Sicilian; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Sicilian woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicelides ... puellae ... Sicelis esse volo, Ov.H.15, 51 sq.: Nymphae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Theocritus</tr>, <tr>pastoral</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
siculus: <entryFree id="n44156" type="main" key="Si^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Siculi, A.</entryFree>
sicunde: <entryFree id="n44157" type="main" key="si_cunde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīcundē</orth> <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>si-unde; cf. sicubi, from si-ubi</etym>, <sense id="n44157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">if from anywhere</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sicunde potes, erues, qui decem legati Mummio fuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicunde spes aliqua se ostendisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicunde hostis appareat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicunde discederet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sicut: <entryFree id="n44158" type="main" key="si_cut"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīc-ut</orth> <itype>and</itype> (far less. freq. but class.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">sīc-ŭti</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n44158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">so as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44158.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44158.2" n="A" level="2"> With a separate clause. </sense><sense id="n44158.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Form sicut: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut dixi, faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clanculum, sicut praecepi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nempe sicut dicis (shortly after: ita ut dicis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sicut dicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae sunt, sicut praedico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia magna est, Hominem amatorem ad forum procedere, etc. ... sicut ego feci stultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ille huc redibit, sicut confido affore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ut tu huic potes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum Montem Sacrum, sicut erat in simili causā antea factum, deinde Aventinum (occupasse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 18, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut ait Ennius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut sapiens poëta dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut se quoque, sicut socios, dignos existimetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valeant preces apud te meae, sicut pro te hodie valuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules turpissimi, sicut hi recentes rerum exitus declararunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut summarum summa est aeterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut Cicero dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut ostendimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:174 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 174 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44158.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Form sicuti: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti dixi prius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habuit ille, sicuti meminisse vos arbitror, permulta signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti me quoque erroris mei paenitet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem Romam, sicuti ego accepi, condidere atque habuere initio Trojani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti dignum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:148" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44158.5" n="b" level="4"> Corresp. to ita, itidem, sic. </sense><sense id="n44158.6" n="(a)" level="5"> Form sicut: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut tuom vis gnatum tuae Superesse vitae, Ita te obtestor, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: sicut verbis nuncupavi, ita pro republicā Quiritium ... legiones mecum Dis Manibus devoveo, an old formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut coronatus laureā coronā oraculum adisset, ita, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:8" default="NO">9, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:100" default="NO">9, 3, 100</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 1, 1: sicut medico diligenti natura corporis cognoscenda est, sic equidem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut magno accidit casu, ut, etc.... sic magnae fuit fortunae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti merci pretium statuit ... Itidem divos dispertisse vitam humanam aequom fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44158.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Form sicuti: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti ... ita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. infra, B. b.—</sense><sense id="n44158.8" n="B" level="2"> Without a separate verb (so most freq.). </sense><sense id="n44158.9" n="(a)" level="5"> Form sicut: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut fortunatorum memorant insulas (is est ager),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut familiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 46</bibl>: te esse sapientem, nec sicut <cb n="SICU" /> vulgus, sed ut eruditi solent appellare sapientem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeciae, sicut apud nos, delubra magnifica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non debent esse amicitiarum sicut aliarum rerum satietates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tuo judicio uteretur, sicut in rebus omnibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam suam hanc esse Galliam, sicut illam nostram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil me, sicut antea, juvat Scribere versiculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc, sicut omni vitā, tum petentem premebat nobilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 9, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sicut vulnere sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 638</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n44158.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Form sicuti: <cit><quote lang="la">me amicissime cottidie magis Caesar amplectitur: familiares quidem ejus, sicuti neminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: sicuti te, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 174, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44158.11" n="b" level="4"> Corresp. to ita, item, sic, etc. (cf. supra, A. b.): <cit><quote lang="la">praecipuum lumen sicut eloquentiae, ita praeceptis quoque ejus, dedit M. Tullius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem. § 29; 9, 1, 18; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 1, 14: sicut in foro non bonos oratores, item in theatro actores malos perpeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi, sicut Campani Capuam, sic Rhegium habituri perpetuam sedem erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut in vitā, in causis quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17</bibl> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n44158.12" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44158.13" n="A" level="2"> With an accessory idea of cause, <hi rend="ital">inasmuch as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since</hi> (perh. only in the two foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc occasio'st faciundi, prius quam in urbem advenerit, sicut cras hic aderit, hodie non venerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo lubet, sicut soror Ejus huc gemina advenit Ephesum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44158.14" n="B" level="2"> Pregn.: sicut est, erat, etc., in confirmation of a former proposition, <hi rend="ital">as indeed it is</hi> (<hi rend="ital">was</hi>), <hi rend="ital">as it really is</hi> (<hi rend="ital">was</hi>), <hi rend="ital">as is</hi> (<hi rend="ital">was</hi>) <hi rend="ital">the fact</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">a favorite expression with Cic.): sint nobis isti, qui de ratione vivendi disserunt, magni homines, ut sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc accedit, quod, quamvis ille felix sit, sicut est, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit ista res magna, sicut est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit licet, sicut est, ab omni ambitione longe remotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa, quamvis ridicula essent, sicut erant, mihi tamen risum non moverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundam eam Paulus, sicut erat, victoriam ratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poteratque viri vox illa videri, sicuti erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis scelerati illi fuissent, sicuti fuerunt, pestiferi cives tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 230</bibl></cit>.—Less freq. with other verbs: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis enim multis locis dicat Epicurus, sicut dicit, satis fortiter de dolore, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl></cit> Beier: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam in consuetudine cottidianā perspexisses, sicuti perspicies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fore, sicut accidit, videbat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrendi magis hostes erant quam fallendi, sicut territi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 24</bibl></cit>.— Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">re verā</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud nos, re verā sicut sunt, mercenarii scribae existimantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44158.15" n="C" level="2"> For introducing a term of comparison, <hi rend="ital">as it were</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as if</hi>, = tamquam (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut sese splendore animi et vitae suae sicut speculum praebeat civibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:42:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 42, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, sicut unus paterfamilias, loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me sicut alterum parentem et observat et diligit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(natura) rationem in capite sicut in arce posuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:29:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 29, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his duabus diversis sicuti familiis unum quoddam est conflatum genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ejus (cornus) summo, sicut palmae, rami quam late diffunduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi mortales vitam sicut peregrinantes transegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 60, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44158.16" n="D" level="2"> For introducing an example, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as for instance</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus in causis omnibus, sicut in ipsā M.' Curii ... fuit summa de jure dissensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 238</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus periculis, sicut cum Spartam oppugnavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,016:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pel. 4</bibl></cit>: sicuti cum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 154, 27</bibl>: sicuti si, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 5</bibl> (Ann. v. 344 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 89</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:91" default="NO">9, 3, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:17" default="NO">7, 2, 17</bibl>; 8, 3, 51; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">85 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44158.17" n="E" level="2"> Sicut eram, erat, etc., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">w(s ei)xon</foreign>, to denote an unchanged condition of the subject in a new state of action, <hi rend="ital">just as I</hi> (<hi rend="ital">he</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">was</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">sicut eram, fugio sine vestibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 601</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 657</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut erat, rectos defert in Tartara currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:820" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 820</bibl></cit>; so, sicut erat, <cb n="SIDE" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 680</bibl>; 4, 803; 10, 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 365</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille, sicut nudatus erat, pervenit ad Graecos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:4:2" default="NO">10, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut erat togatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:2:4 al" default="NO">26, 2, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 178</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:18" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.—Less freq. with another verb: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut curru eminebat, oculos circumferens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitatum in flumen, sicut vestitus advenerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 9</bibl></cit>.—Form sicuti: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti erat, cruentā veste, in castra pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 3, 10</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44158.18" n="F" level="1"> A few times in Sallust with an accessory hypothetical signif., <hi rend="ital">as if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as if</hi>, = quasi: <cit><quote lang="la">alii sicuti populi jura defenderent, pars, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 38, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti jurgio lacessitus foret, in Senatum venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti audiri a suis aut cerni possent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 60, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti salutatum introire ad Ciceronem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 28, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44158.19" n="G" level="1"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">as soon as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sicut adulescit, terram inde colligimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Apr. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sicuti: <entryFree id="n44159" type="main" key="si_cu^ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīcŭti</orth>, v. sicut.</entryFree>
sicyon: <entryFree id="n44160" type="main" key="Si^cy^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcyon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> e, rarely i), <gen>f.</gen> (but <sense id="n44160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*sikuw/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the capital of the territory of Sicyonia in the Peloponnesus</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Vasiliko</hi>), <hi rend="ital">near the isthmus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sometimes considered as belonging to Achaia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in olive-trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Aratus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 6, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:315" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 315</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:15:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 15, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:62 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 62 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> Sicyoni, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 38</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Sicyone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 21, 1</bibl> and 2.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcyōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sicyon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sicyonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:17:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 17, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcei,</quote> <trans><tr>a lcind of soft shoes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">baca,</quote> <trans><tr>olives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 15</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44160.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭ-cyōnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sicyon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Sicyonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 10 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44160.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcyōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Sicyonian shoes</hi>, Lucil. ap. Fest. s. h. v. p. 337 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1125</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 168</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sicyos: <entryFree id="n44161" type="greek" key="si^cy^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭcyos agrĭos</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">si/kuos a)/grios</foreign>, <sense id="n44161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wildcucumber</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sida: <entryFree id="n44162" type="main" key="Si_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīdē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 26, § 96</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*si/dh</foreign>, <sense id="n44162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Pamphylia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Eski Adalia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:14 sq" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 14 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 23 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīdētae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sidh=tai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sida</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 48, 6</bibl> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sideralis: <entryFree id="n44163" type="main" key="si_de^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīdĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sidus</etym>, <sense id="n44163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sidereal</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 160</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">difficultas,</quote> <trans><tr>astronomy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 24, 56, § 206</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sideraticius: <entryFree id="n44164" type="main" key="si_de^ra_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīdĕrātīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sideratio</etym>, <sense id="n44164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">planet-struck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blasted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palsied</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. sideror.</sense></entryFree>
sideratio: <entryFree id="n44165" type="main" key="si_de^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīdĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sideror</etym>. * <sense id="n44165.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A grouping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">configuration of stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>, Firm. Math. 4, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n44165.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A disease produced by a constellation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a blast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sideration;</hi> of plants, <hi rend="ital">a blast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a blight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:222 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 222 sq.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of animals,</quote> <trans><tr>a numbness</tr>, <tr>palsy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Emp. 20 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Larg. 101" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Larg. 101 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sideratus: <entryFree id="n44166" type="main" key="si_de^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīdĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sideror.</entryFree>
sidereus: <entryFree id="n44167" type="main" key="si_de^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīdĕrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sidus</etym>. <sense id="n44167.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the constellations</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">starry</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Ov.): caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 140</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: arx mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput (Noctis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the moon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 20, 18: <cit><quote lang="la">aethra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 586</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the stars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 665</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:941" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 941</bibl></cit>: conjux, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ceyx</hi> (as the son of Lucifer), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 445</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pedo,</quote> <trans><tr>who discoursed of the stars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:112" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidereā qui temperat omnia luce (sol),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 169</bibl></cit>;
