so, <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, of the sun: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 779</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:60:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 60, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colossus,</quote> <trans><tr>dedicated to the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:643" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 643</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44167.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44167.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Heavenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:292" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <trans><tr>of gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:166" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 166</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44167.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glittering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, etc. (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">Venus sidereos diffusa sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:104" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus (Veneris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:141" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore (Pollux),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:490" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus (Bacchi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 409" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 409</bibl></cit> et saep.: (Aeneas) Sidereo <pb n="1695" /> <cb n="SIDO" /> dagrans clipeo et caelestibus armis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubae (cassidis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutrop. 1, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:66:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 66, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:37:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 37, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates Maro,</quote> <trans><tr>brilliant</tr>, <tr>divine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:434" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 434</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
siderion: <entryFree id="n44168" type="greek" key="si^de_ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭdērĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sidh/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n44168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant ironwort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vervain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 15, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:140" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 14, 87, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
siderites: <entryFree id="n44169" type="greek" key="si^de_ri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭdērītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sidhri/ths</foreign>. <sense id="n44169.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A loadstone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 127</bibl> (Jan. sideritis).—</sense><sense id="n44169.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of diamond</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 4, 16, § 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sideritesis: <entryFree id="n44170" type="greek" key="si^de_ri_te^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭdērītĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">sidhri=tis</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n44170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> heliotropium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 49</bibl> (al. sideritis).</sense></entryFree>
sideritis: <entryFree id="n44171" type="greek" key="si^de_ri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭdērītis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sidhri=tis</foreign>. <sense id="n44171.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ironwort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vervain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 19, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:148" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 14, 88, § 148</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44171.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 182</bibl>. A variety of it, found in Æthiopia, is called <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭdērŏpoecĭlos</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">sidhropoi/kilos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 182</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44171.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The loadstone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 127</bibl> Jan.</sense></entryFree>
sideropoecilos: <entryFree id="n44172" type="main" key="si^de_ro^poeci^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭdērŏpoecĭlos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. sideritis, II.</entryFree>
sideror: <entryFree id="n44173" type="main" key="si_de^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīdĕror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n44173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [sidus, II. E.], <hi rend="ital">to be blasted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">palsied by a constellation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be planet-struck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sunstruck</hi>, = sidere afflari, <foreign lang="greek">a)strobolei=sqai</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluviatilium silurus Caniculae exortu sideratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 25, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siderati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 16, 63, § 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sideratum jumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 39, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
siderosus: <entryFree id="n44174" type="gloss" key="si_de^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīdĕrōsus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)stroplh/c</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
sidetae: <entryFree id="n44175" type="main" key="Si_de_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīdētae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. Sida.</entryFree>
sidicini: <entryFree id="n44176" type="main" key="Si^di^ci_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭdĭcīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose chief town was</hi> Teanum, <hi rend="ital">on the north-eastern side of Mount Massicus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 1</bibl> sq.; 8, 15 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 107</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Egnatii Sidicini nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭdĭcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> Sidicini, <hi rend="ital">Sidicinian</hi>: ager, Liv 10, 14; <cit><quote lang="la">26, 9: aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:551" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sido: <entryFree id="n44177" type="main" key="si_do1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīdo</orth>, <itype>sīdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cf. sedeo; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i(/zw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n44177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to seat one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sit down; to settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alight</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; usu. of things) </sense><sense id="n44177.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesitisque diu terris, ubi sidere detur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 307</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(columbae) super arbore sidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes sidentes,</quote> <trans><tr>sitting down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 177</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44177.2" n="b" level="4"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to sink down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidebant campi (shortly after: subsidere saxa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec membris incussam sidere cretam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 382</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:24:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 24, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tepidā aquā gutta (balsami) sidens ad ima vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cummi in aquā sidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave lecticā sidat,</quote> <trans><tr>be set down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 78: <cit><quote lang="la">prius caelum sidet inferius mari, Quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:79" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44177.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., pregn. </sense><sense id="n44177.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be set fast; to remain sitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare certis canalibus ita profundum, ut nullae ancorae sidant,</quote> <trans><tr>can hold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secures sidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum queror, in toto non sidere pallia lecto,</quote> <trans><tr>remain lying</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 31.—</sense><sense id="n44177.5" n="2" level="3"> Naut. t. t., of a vessel, <hi rend="ital">to stick fast</hi> on shallows: <cit><quote lang="la">veniat mea litore navis Servata, an mediis sidat onusta vadis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit> (3, 6), 30; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi eae (cymbae) siderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 4, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44177.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sink down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sink out of sight.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44177.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non flebo in cineres arcem sidisse paternos Cadmi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit> (4, 8), 37: sidentes in tabem spectat acervos, <hi rend="ital">settling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">melting down</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:791" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 791</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:199" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 199</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44177.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia civitatis pessum suā mole sidentis,</quote> <trans><tr>sinking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sidentia imperii fundamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 20, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidente paulatim metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44178" type="main" key="Sido2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sido</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief of the</hi> Suevi <hi rend="ital">about the middle of the first century</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:29 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 29 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sidon: <entryFree id="n44179" type="main" key="Si_don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīdon</orth>, <itype>ō^nis</itype> (usu. ō, as in Greek; but in the derivatives <sense id="n44179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">common.</hi> A later collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīdōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:10:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 10, 8</bibl>; cf.: Babylonia, Lacedaemonia, etc.), <hi rend="ital">f</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sidw/n, w=nos</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">o/nos</foreign>, Heb. and Phoen. <foreign /> <hi rend="ital">a very ancient and celebrated Phœnician city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mother-city of Tyre</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Saida</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 19, 17, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:217 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 217 al.</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Sidone, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 585</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 571</bibl>; cf. <case>acc.</case> Sīdōna Verg A. 1, 619; <case>abl.</case> Sīdŏne, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8</bibl>, <cb n="SIDU" /> 438.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44179.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīdŏ_nĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n44179.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sidon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sidonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Sidon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 545</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:77" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: amor, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Jupiter's for Europa</hi> (of Sidon), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:32" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44179.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Phœnician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Europa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cadmus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nautae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:59" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:18" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ostrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit> (3, 8), 55: <cit><quote lang="la">chlamys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 47: <cit><quote lang="la">mitra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit> (3, 27), 15 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n44179.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:213" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:474" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 474</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44179.5" n="4" level="3"> Because Thebes, in Bœotia, was said to have been founded by Cadmus, <hi rend="ital">Theban</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sidoniae comites, i. e. Ismenides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:443" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 443</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīdō^nĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Sidonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 78:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 78, 1</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Phœnicians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:108" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 108</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n44179.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīdōnĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sidon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sidonian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 78:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 78, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44179.7" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīdō^nis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sidonian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Phœnician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Phœnicia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 840</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concha,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>purple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:267" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 267</bibl></cit>.—More freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Sidonian</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Phœnician woman;</hi> of <hi rend="ital">Europa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:610" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 610</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 617</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:334" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 334</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">Dido</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 80</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">Anna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:649" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 649</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:70" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sīdōnĭda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:194" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 194</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sidonius: <entryFree id="n44180" type="main" key="Si_do^ni^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīdŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name;</hi> so, C. Sollius Sidonius Apollinaris, <hi rend="ital">a Christian writer in the middle of the fifth century</hi>, whose Carmina and Epistolae are still extant; v. Bähr, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 291.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n44181" type="main" key="Si_do_^ni^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīdō^nĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sidon, A.</entryFree>
sidus: <entryFree id="n44182" type="main" key="si_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīdus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. svid, to sweat, melt; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">si/dhros</foreign> (molten) iron; Lat. sudo</etym>. <sense id="n44182.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Stars united in a figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a group of stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi> (and hence mostly <number>plur.</number>; <cit><quote lang="la">only so ap. Cic., Cæs., and Quint.): sunt stellae quidem singulares, ut erraticae quinque et ceterae, quae non admixtae aliis solae feruntur: sidera vero, quae in aliquod signum stellarum plurium compositione formantur, ut Aries, Taurus, Andromeda, Perseus, vel Corona et quaecumque variarum genera formarum in caelum recepta creduntur. Sic et apud Graecos aster et astron diversa significant et aster stella una est, astron signum stellis coactum, quod nos sidus vocamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> </sense><sense id="n44182.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi sempiterni ignes, quae sidera et stellas vocatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signis sideribusque caelestibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:13:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circuitus solis et lunae reliquorumque siderum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 62, 155</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">solem lunamque praecipua siderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in sole sidera ipsa desinunt cerni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siderum regina bicornis Luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:35" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arcturi sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis, i. e. sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera, quae vocantur errantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 89</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">errantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siderum motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera viderit innumerabilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 39</bibl> et saep.; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:38" default="NO">2, 17, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:10 al" default="NO">12, 11, 10 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:788" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 788</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1065" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 1065</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">candida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surgentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 850</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radiantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:406 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 406 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44182.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a heavenly body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a star;</hi> and collect., <hi rend="ital">a group of stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarum Tyndaridae sidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervidum,</quote> <trans><tr>Sirius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">nivosum sidus Pleiadum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:95" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insana Caprae sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baccho placuisse coronam, Ex Ariadnaeo sidere nosse potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:346" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 346</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the constellation Arcturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 311</bibl></cit> (for which, in the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arcturi sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 204</bibl></cit>); of <hi rend="ital">Capella</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 594</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">the Vergiliae</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 35, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 6, 12</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">Saturn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:32 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 32 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:569" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 569</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">Venus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 661</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">the Moon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 41</bibl></cit>; of <hi rend="ital">the Sun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calidi sideris aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:47" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetherium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 424</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 60, 60, § 212</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solstitiale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: sidus utrumque, for <hi rend="ital">the rising and setting sun</hi>, Petr. poët. 119, 2; and also for <hi rend="ital">the sun and moon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 13, 10</bibl>, §§ 56 and 57.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, collect.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sidus fefellit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>through ignorance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 215</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44182.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. <cb n="SIGA" /> prose). </sense><sense id="n44182.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the heavens</hi>, = caelum. (Juppiter) terram, mare, sidera movit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 180</bibl>: (Hercules) flammis ad sidera missus, Juv.11,63; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">abrupto sidere nimbus It,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera observare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44182.5" n="2" level="3"> Like caelum, to denote <hi rend="ital">a very great height</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyramidum sumptus ad sidera ducti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit> (4, 1), 17: <cit><quote lang="la">evertunt actas ad sidera pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 136</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sidera Erigitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves, quas naturalis levitas ageret ad sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus quae vertice sidera pulsat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:36:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 36, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:62:10" default="NO">9, 62, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 427</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 243</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:62 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 62 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44182.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (also like caelum), as <hi rend="ital">the summit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">height</hi> of fame, fortune, success, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi me lyricis vatibus inseris, Sublimi feriam sidera vertice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertice sidera tangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum nomen ... Cantantes sublime ferent ad sidera cygni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad sidera notus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 43</bibl></cit>: contingere sidera plantis, <hi rend="ital">to walk upon the stars</hi> (like the gods) (of one exceedingly fortunate), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:43" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 43</bibl> (1, 8 b, 17); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">celerique fugā sub sidera lapsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 243</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44182.7" n="B" level="2"> For <hi rend="ital">night</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exactis sideribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:38" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera producere ludo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:219" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 219</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sideribus dubiis,</quote> <trans><tr>at dawn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:22" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44182.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A star</hi>, as a comparison for any thing bright, brilliant, shining, beautiful, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">stella, astrum): oculi, geminae, sidera nostra, faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the eyes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 499</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidere pulchrior Ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 47</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of form, beauty,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:468" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 468</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44182.9" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o sidus Fabiae, Maxime, gentis ades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:6:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Col. poët, 10, 96: puerum egregiae praeclarum sidere formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedoniae columen ac sidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—As a term of endearment, <hi rend="ital">my star</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:41" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44182.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Season</hi> of the year: <cit><quote lang="la">quo sidere terram Vertere Conveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hiberno moliris sidere classem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidere aequinoctii quo maxime tumescit Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">brumale sidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:4:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidere flagrante brumali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 12, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44182.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Climate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weather</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut patrios fontes patriumque sidus ferre consuevisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:15:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 15, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sub nostro sidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:103" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot inhospita saxa Sideraque emensae,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 628</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grave sidus et imbrem vitare,</quote> <trans><tr>tempest</tr>, <tr>storm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triste Minervae (raised by Minerva),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 260</bibl></cit>.—Colloquially, with <hi rend="ital">confectus</hi>: intellegitur sidus confectum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that the weather</hi> (<hi rend="ital">occasioned by a constellation</hi>) <hi rend="ital">is ended</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 23, 36, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:207" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 25, 57, § 207</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fertur in abruptum casu, non sidere, puppis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 424</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44182.12" n="E" level="2"> With allusion to the influence which the ancients believed the constellations to have upon the health or the destiny of men, <hi rend="ital">star</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destiny</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pestifero sidere icti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: sidere afflari, <hi rend="ital">to be blasted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">palsied by a constellation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be planet-struck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sunstruck</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)strobolei=sqai</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 41, 41, § 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sidere percussa lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:85:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 85, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito fias ut sidere mutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:92:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 92, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. sideror and sideratio: sidera natalicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 43, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">o sidere dextro Edite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:63" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adveniet fausto cum sidere conjux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 330</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere duro sidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:36" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grave sidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 45</bibl></cit> Jahn: <cit><quote lang="la">per alias civitates ut sidus salutare susciperetur,</quote> <trans><tr>as arbiter of their destiny</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
siem: <entryFree id="n44183" type="main" key="siem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siem</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sies</orth>, etc., v. sum <sense id="n44183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sifilum: <entryFree id="n44184" type="main" key="si_fi^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīfĭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, collat. form of sibilum, q. v.</entryFree>
sigalion: <entryFree id="n44185" type="main" key="Si_ga^li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīgălĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">siga/w</foreign>, to be silent</etym>, <sense id="n44185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god of Silence among the Egyptians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 25, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sigambri: <entryFree id="n44186" type="main" key="Si^gambri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭgambri</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭcambri, Sy-gambri</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭgambri</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*su/gambroi</foreign>, Ptol. Dio Cass.; <foreign lang="greek">*sou/gambroi</foreign>, Strabo, <sense id="n44186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a powerful people of Germany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Sieg and the Ruhr</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and as far as the Lippe</hi> (the mod. <hi rend="ital">Cleve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Berg</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">Recklingshausen</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 18</bibl> sq.; 6, 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 3:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 3, 9</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44186.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭgamber</orth>, <itype>bra, brum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> Sigambri, <hi rend="ital">Sigambrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭgambra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Sigambrian</hi> <pb n="1696" /> <cb n="SIGN" /> <hi rend="ital">woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44186.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭgam-brĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the</hi> Sigambri, <hi rend="ital">Sigambria</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 383</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sigeum: <entryFree id="n44187" type="main" key="Si_ge_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīgēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*si/geion</foreign>, <sense id="n44187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory in Troas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and a town of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Achilles was buried</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Yenishehr</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 28, 6</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīgēus</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīgēïa</orth> <itype>tellus</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sigeïa litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 3</bibl></cit>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sigeum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sigean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">freta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 197</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n44187.1" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natum Sigeo in pulvere,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>in the Trojan war</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44187.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:203" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 203</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
siggos: <entryFree id="n44188" type="main" key="Siggos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Siggos</orth>, v. Singos.</entryFree>
sigilla: <entryFree id="n44189" type="main" key="si^gilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭgilla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (<number>sing.</number>: SIGILLVM VOLKANI, Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 357; v. also infra, II.), <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>signum</etym>. <sense id="n44189.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Little figures</hi> or <hi rend="ital">images</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apposuit patellam, in quā sigilla erant egregia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:22:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 22, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrrhena sigilla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perparvula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 24, 59, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 407</bibl>: quattuor certamina brevibus distincta sigillis, <hi rend="ital">woven</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wrought in</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 86</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the figures on seal-rings: sigilla anulo imprimere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 26, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44189.1" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a seal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1</bibl> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n44189.2" n="II" level="1"> In the <number>sing.</number> for signum, <hi rend="ital">a sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trace</hi>, Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:326" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 326</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sigillaria: <entryFree id="n44190" type="main" key="Si^gilla_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭgillārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum, ibus and iis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sigilla</etym>. <sense id="n44190.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The last days of the Saturnalia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which people made each other presents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially of little images; the feast of images</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11</bibl>; Tiber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Carac. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (called by <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Eclog. Fer. Rom. 52</bibl>, festa sigillorum; and by Lucil. ap. Porph. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 87</bibl>, Servorum festus).—</sense><sense id="n44190.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44190.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The little images presented on the</hi> Sigillaria: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui sigillaria afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 3</bibl></cit> (called sigillaricia, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 17</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n44190.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Images of the gods</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adoratis sigillaribus suis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Or. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 197</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 199</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44190.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place in Rome where these little images were sold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the image-market</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Sigillaribus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:102" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sigillariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sigillariarius: <entryFree id="n44191" type="gloss" key="si^gilla_ri^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭgillārĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sigiliaria, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n44191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of images</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4280</bibl>. —Also called SIGILLARIVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4279</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and SIGILLATOR FIGVLVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4191</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sigillaricius: <entryFree id="n44192" type="main" key="si^gilla_ri_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭgillārīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sigilla</etym>. * <sense id="n44192.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sealing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus,</quote> <trans><tr>a seal-ring</tr>, <tr>signet-ring</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44192.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭgillārīcĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">little images;</hi> v. Sigillaria, II. A. 1.</sense></entryFree>
sigillarius: <entryFree id="n44193" type="gloss" key="si^gilla_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭgillārĭus</orth> and ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭgillātor</orth>, v. ‡ sigillariarius.</entryFree>
sigillatim: <entryFree id="n44194" type="main" key="si^gilla_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭgillātim</orth>, v. singillatim.</entryFree>
sigillatus: <entryFree id="n44195" type="main" key="si^gilla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭgillātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sigilla</etym>, <sense id="n44195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adorned with little images</hi> or <hi rend="ital">figures</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scyphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:14:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 14, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putealia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentoria, Treb. XXX. Tyr. 16: serica, Cod. Th. 15, 7, 11: sal,</quote> <trans><tr>the pillar of salt into which Lot's wife was changed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 707</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sigilliola: <entryFree id="n44196" type="main" key="si^gilli^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭgillĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little figures</hi> or <hi rend="ital">images</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 197</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 204</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sigillo: <entryFree id="n44197" type="gloss" key="si^gillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭgillo</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">sfragi/zw</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
sigillum: <entryFree id="n44198" type="main" key="si^gillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭgillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, v. sigilla.</entryFree>
sigimerus: <entryFree id="n44199" type="main" key="Sigimerus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sigimerus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Seg-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prince of the</hi> Cherusci, <hi rend="ital">the father of Arminius and brother of Segestes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:118:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 118, 2</bibl>.—Segimerus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sigla: <entryFree id="n44200" type="main" key="sigla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sigla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from sigilla</etym>, <sense id="n44200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">signs of abbreviation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abbreviations</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sigla in libris ponere, Just. Ep. ad Antecess. § 8: leges per siglorum obscuritates conscribere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 17, 2, § 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sigma: <entryFree id="n44201" type="greek" key="sigma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sigma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">si/gma</foreign> (the Greek letter sigma; hence, from its more ancient form, C). <sense id="n44201.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A semicircular couch</hi> for reclining at meals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:87:2" default="NO">14, 87, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44201.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bathing-tub</hi> of the same shape, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. 17, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
signaculum: <entryFree id="n44202" type="main" key="signa_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>signo</etym>. <sense id="n44202.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sign</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>circumcision</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontis inscripta oleo,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>the sign of the cross</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 360</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44202.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a seal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 346</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:1:section=36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 1, § 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Novat.</author> Th. 2</bibl>, tit. 16, c. 1, § 5. <cb n="SIGN" /></sense></entryFree>
signanter: <entryFree id="n44203" type="main" key="signanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. signo <sense id="n44203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
signarius: <entryFree id="n44204" type="gloss" key="signa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>signum</etym>, <sense id="n44204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sculptor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ARTIFEX,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4282</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
signate: <entryFree id="n44205" type="main" key="signa_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>signo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> B. <sense id="n44205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
signatio: <entryFree id="n44206" type="hapax" key="signa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>signo</etym>, <sense id="n44206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtiva (crucis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
signator: <entryFree id="n44207" type="main" key="signa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n44207.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sealer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signer.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44207.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One who attests a will by sealing it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a witness to a will</hi> (mostly postAug.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): ex illis testes signatoresque falsos commodare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signator falso,</quote> <trans><tr>a forger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl>, Esd. 10, 1.—</sense><sense id="n44207.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One who affixes his seal as witness to a marriage-contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a witness to a marriage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:336" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 336</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44207.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who stamps money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a coiner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1066, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1070, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
signatorius: <entryFree id="n44208" type="main" key="signa_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sealing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus,</quote> <trans><tr>a seal-ring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:14:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:74" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25:section=10" default="NO">34, 2, 25, § 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">signātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sealing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Ep. 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
signatus: <entryFree id="n44209" type="main" key="signa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of signo.</entryFree>
signia: <entryFree id="n44210" type="main" key="Signi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Signĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town in Latium which produced an astringent wine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Segni</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 21</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 8, 3; 32, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6</bibl>. 8, § 65; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:380" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 380</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Signīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Signia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Signian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 19</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:116" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:73 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 73 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of plaster for walls and pavements</tr>, <tr>made of potsherds and lime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:3" default="NO">8, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:1" default="NO">8, 17, 1</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44210.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Signīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = Signinum opus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 165</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n44210.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Signīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Signia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Signians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
signias: <entryFree id="n44211" type="main" key="Signi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Signĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*signi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n44211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Greater Phrygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
signifer: <entryFree id="n44212" type="main" key="signi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>signumfero</etym>. <sense id="n44212.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">sign-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagebearing</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">bearing signs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figures</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">images</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): puppis, i.e. <hi rend="ital">adorned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">painted with images</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 558</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">crater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:337" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans><tr>giving signals</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44212.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (class.). </sense><sense id="n44212.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Bearing the heavenly signs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">constellations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">starry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 363</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:172" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 172</bibl>: orbis, qui Graece <foreign lang="greek">zwdiako\s</foreign> dicitur, <hi rend="ital">the zodiac</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 89</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 691</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:11:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 11, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also, polus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 254</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 1, 1</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> signifer, <hi rend="ital">the sky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the heavens</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:7:12:8" default="NO">7, 12, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 10, 7, § 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 365 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44212.3" n="B" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n44212.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a standard-bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ensign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signifero interfecto, signo amisso, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 12, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44212.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae causae duces et quasi signiferi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:30:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 30, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signifer juventutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 12, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 25, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl>; id. Vit. Luc.</sense></entryFree>
signifex: <entryFree id="n44213" type="main" key="signi^fex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfex</orth>, <itype>fĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>signum-facio</etym>, <sense id="n44213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an image-maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statuary</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 116, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 199</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
significabilis: <entryFree id="n44214" type="hapax" key="signi^fi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>significo</etym>, <sense id="n44214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">significative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 52</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
significans: <entryFree id="n44215" type="main" key="signi^fi^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of significo.</entryFree>
significanter: <entryFree id="n44216" type="main" key="signi^fi^canter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfĭcanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. significo, <sense id="n44216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
significantia: <entryFree id="n44217" type="main" key="signi^fi^canti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfĭcantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>significo</etym> (postAug.). * <sense id="n44217.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">energy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">significancy</hi> of words: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:121" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44217.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">import</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signification</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 230</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
significatio: <entryFree id="n44218" type="main" key="signi^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n44218.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pointing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indicating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">denoting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signifying; an expression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, = indicium, signum, <foreign lang="greek">e)pishmasi/a</foreign>, etc. (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n44218.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus sententiam non demonstratione sed significatione declarans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem nutu significationeque appellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: ignibus significatione factā. Caes. B. G. <cb n="SIGN" /> 2, 33: <cit><quote lang="la">significatione per castella fumo factā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 81</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex significatione Gallorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44218.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj. gen.</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 29</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">significatio calamitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:25:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 25, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 30, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 7, 2</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinis significationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:69:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 69, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum futurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:166" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 166</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44218.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus magna significatio fit, non adesse constantiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 36, 131</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multas nec dubias significationes saepe jecit: ne reliquis quidem se parsurum senatoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44218.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44218.5" n="A" level="2"> Pregn., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)pishmasi/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a sign</hi> or <hi rend="ital">token of assent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an expression of approbation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">applause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi judiciis atque omni significatione florere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:49:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 49, 105</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 57, 122</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">59, 127: ut ex ipsā significatione potuit cognosci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 86</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:14:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 14, § 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">significationibus acclamationibus multitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 15, 2</bibl></cit> (corresp. to assentatio).—</sense><sense id="n44218.6" n="B" level="2"> Also, like <foreign lang="greek">e)pishmasi/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foretoken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prognostic</hi> of the weather (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">est et aquarum significatio, etc.... caeli quidem murmur non dubiam habet significationem. Praesagiunt et animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:359 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 85, § 359 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44218.7" n="C" level="2"> In rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">significance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emphasis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">significatio est, quae plus in suspicione relinquit, quam positum est in oratione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct.
