Her.</author> 4, 53, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 40, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 3</bibl> (as a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/mfasis</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n44218.8" n="D" level="2"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">import</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signification</hi> of a word or phrase: <cit><quote lang="la">verbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=40" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 40</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">scripti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:31:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 31, 108</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est igitur tropus sermo a naturali et principali significatione translatus ad aliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusdem verbi contraria significatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces eaedem diversā in significatione ponuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—So the titles of the lexical works of Aelius Gallus, Verrius Flaccus, Festus, etc.: De verborum Significatione or Significationibus.—</sense><sense id="n44218.9" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas significationes habet propositio vestra,</quote> <trans><tr>includes two assertions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
significativus: <entryFree id="n44219" type="main" key="signi^fi^ca_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfĭcātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>significo</etym>, <sense id="n44219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">denoting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signifying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">significative</hi> (jurid. Lat.); with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">enuntiatio et quantitatis et aestimationis significativa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:232" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 232</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:75:section=2" default="NO">45, 1, 75, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
significatorius: <entryFree id="n44220" type="main" key="signi^fi^ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfĭcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">denoting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signifying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">significatory</hi> (late Lat.); with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (like significativus): <cit><quote lang="la">verbum factitationis significatorium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 32</bibl></cit>; Ambros. Incarn. Dom. Sacr. § 98.</sense></entryFree>
significatum: <entryFree id="n44221" type="gloss" key="signi^fi^ca_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfĭcātum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">shmasi/a, dh/lwsis</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
significatus: <entryFree id="n44222" type="main" key="signi^fi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>significo</etym> (postAug. for significatio, II. B. and D.). <sense id="n44222.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prognostic</hi> of coming changes of weather: tempestatum significatus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 59, § 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:310" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 31, 74, § 310</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44222.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">import</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signification</hi> of a word (syn. vis): <cit><quote lang="la">ve particula duplicem significatum capit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44222.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appellation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellis significatum dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
significo: <entryFree id="n44223" type="main" key="signi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n44223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfĭcor</orth>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:12:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 12, 10</bibl>, without an example), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>signum-facio</etym>. </sense><sense id="n44223.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to show by signs; to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">point out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">express</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indicate; to intimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signify</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; syn.: monstro, declaro, indico). </sense><sense id="n44223.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mihi significasse et annuisse visus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:91:section=213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 91, § 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae significari ac declarari volemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:13:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 13, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratulationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timorem fremitu et concursu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir, quem ne inimicus quidem satis in appellando significare poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 17, 39</bibl></cit> (13, 29): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid per gestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 36</bibl></cit> et saep.— With two <case>acc.</case> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut eorum ornatus in his regem neminem significaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44223.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object clause</hi>: hoc tibi non significandum solum, sed etiam <pb n="1697" /> <cb n="SIGN" /> declarandum arbitror, nihil mihi esse potuisse tuis litteris gratius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provocationem a regibus fuisse significant nostri augurales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se esse admodum delectatos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 30, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes voce significare coeperunt, sese, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc significant, sese ad statuas tuas pecuniam contulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:60:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 60, § 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44223.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque unde, nec quo die datae essent (litterae), aut quo tempore te exspectarem, significabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutu significat, quid velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 643</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(anseres et canes) aluntur in Capitolio, ut significent, si fures venerint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">significare coeperunt, ut dimitterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44223.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">significare de fugā Romanis coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est aliquid de virtute significatum tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 21, 52</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversae state ... Neve inter vos significetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">significare inter sese coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quam maxime significem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fumo atque ignibus significabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi major atque illustrior incidit res, clamore per agros regionesque significant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44223.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44223.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To betoken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prognosticate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreshow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi> (syn. praedico): <cit><quote lang="la">futura posse a quibusdam significari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid haec tanta celeritas festinatioque significat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sibi significent, trepidantia consulit exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 576</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi significant ergo mea visa?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:495" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">significet placidos nuntia fibra deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae fato manent, quamvis significata, non vitantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44223.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To betoken</hi> a change of weather (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ventus Africus tempestatem significat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serenos dies (luna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 79, § 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbrem (occasus Librae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 26:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 26, 66</bibl></cit>, § 246.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terreni ignes proxime significant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 84, § 357</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44223.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Antoninum filium suum ipse significari voluit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44223.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">import</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signify;</hi> of words: <cit><quote lang="la">carere hoc significat, egere eo, quod habere velis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:36:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa verba aliud nunc ostendunt, aliud ante significabant, ut hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 3</bibl></cit> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">9, § 85 ib.: videtis hoc uno verbo unde significare res duas, et ex quo et a quo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:30:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 30, 88</bibl></cit>.—Of a fable: <cit><quote lang="la">haec significat fabula dominum videre plurimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 8, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 10, 16</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, in rhet. lang., of speech, <hi rend="ital">full of meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expressive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">significant; graphic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum dilucida et significans descriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:8" default="NO">4, 2, 8</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">31: demonstratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 147</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of orators: <cit><quote lang="la">Atticos esse lucidos et significantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo nihil inveniri possit significantius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:6" default="NO">8, 6, 6</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">significantissimum vocabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭfĭcanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expressly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">significantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graphically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">breviter ac significanter ordinem rei protulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem indicare (with proprie),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere (with ornate),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apertius, significantius dignitatem alicujus defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellare aliquid (with consignatius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:25:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 25, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere (with probabilius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pseudo</author> Quint. Decl. 247</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
signinus: <entryFree id="n44224" type="main" key="Signi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Signīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Signia.</entryFree>
signitenens: <entryFree id="n44225" type="hapax" key="signi^te^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signĭtĕnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [signumteneo], <sense id="n44225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">constellation-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">starry</hi>: bigae, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 19</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 132 Vahl.); cf. signifer.</sense></entryFree>
signo: <entryFree id="n44226" type="main" key="signo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>signum</etym>, <sense id="n44226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set a mark upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">designate</hi> (syn.: noto, designo). </sense><sense id="n44226.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44226.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): discrimen non facit neque signat linea alba, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 405, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signata sanguine pluma est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne signare quidem aut partiri limite campum Fas erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum limite mensor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 8, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:819" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 819</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede certo humum,</quote> <trans><tr>to print</tr>, <tr>press</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 159</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia summo pulvere,</quote> <trans><tr>to mark</tr>, <tr>imprint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 171</bibl></cit>: auratā cyclade humum, <cb n="SIGN" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 7, 40: <cit><quote lang="la">haec nostro signabitur area curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum, ubi ea (cistella) excidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli regionem in cortice signant,</quote> <trans><tr>mark</tr>, <tr>cut</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem stilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem carmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 287</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: carmine saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitum longis litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceram figuris,</quote> <trans><tr>to imprint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor signaverat herbam,</quote> <trans><tr>had stained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 210</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signatum sanguine pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubiā lanugine malas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:754" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 754</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signata in stirpe cicatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus Procne pectus signata cruentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis infinitios sonos paucis notis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visum objectum imprimet et quasi signabit in animo suam speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:19:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 19, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44226.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44226.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To mark with a seal; to seal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seal up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affix a seal to</hi> a thing (usually obsignare): <cit><quote lang="la">accepi a te signatum libellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: locellum tibi signatum remisi, Caes. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 60</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,016:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pel. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcanas tabellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signatis quicquam mandare tabellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:7:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lagenam (anulus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:88:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 88, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 8 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:39:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 39, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nisi signata venumdabatur (terra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 14, § 33</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:70:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 70, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 17</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n44226.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To mark with a stamp;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n44226.6" n="a" level="4"> Of money, <hi rend="ital">to stamp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to coin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes argentum aurumve publice signanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui primus ex auro denarium signavit ... Servius rex primus signavit aes ... Signatum est nota pecudum, unde et pecunia appellata ... Argentum signatum est anno, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum signatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25, § 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:26" default="NO">5, 14, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia signata Illyriorum signo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denarius signatus Victoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed cur navalis in aere Altera signata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:230" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia talentūm argenti non signati formā, sed rudi pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n44226.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">signatum memori pectore nomen habe,</quote> <trans><tr>imprinted</tr>, <tr>impressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(filia) quae patriā signatur imagine vultus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>closely resembles her father</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:27:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44226.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To stamp</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to license</hi>, invest with <hi rend="ital">official authority</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quidam per ampla spatia urbis ... equos velut publicos signatis, quod dicitur, calceis agitant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44226.9" n="3" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to distinguish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decorate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pater ipse suo superūm jam signat honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 781</bibl></cit> Heyne: caelum corona, Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 273.—</sense><sense id="n44226.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to point out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">designate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">express</hi> (rare; more usually significo, designo; in Cic. only Or. 19, 64, where dignata is given by <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 281, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Meyer ad loc.): translatio plerumque signandis rebus ac sub oculos subiciendis reperta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens suis verbis signare nostra voluerunt (Graeci),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatione signare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrius differentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:16" default="NO">12, 10, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen (Caieta) ossa signat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama signata loco est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miratrixque sui signavit nomine terras,</quote> <trans><tr>designated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 655</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Earinus) Nomine qui signat tempora verna suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:17:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turnus ut videt ... So signari oculis,</quote> <trans><tr>singled out</tr>, <tr>looked to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: signare responsum, <hi rend="ital">to give a definite</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distinct answer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:16:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 16, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria signat in quā regione quali adjutore legatoque fratre meo usus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:115" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44226.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To distinguish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recognize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primi clipeos mentitaque tela Adgnoscunt, atque ora sono discordia signant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 423</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sonis homines dignoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo signa quodcumque in corpore mendum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 417</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44226.12" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To seal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">establish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confirm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prescribe</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">signanda sunt jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 20, 15: <cit><quote lang="la">signata jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 302</bibl></cit>: jura Suevis, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 380</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">precati deos ut velint ea (vota) semper solvi semperque signari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 35</bibl></cit> (44).—</sense><sense id="n44226.13" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui prima novo signat quinquennia lustro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:45:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 45, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44226.14" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">signan-ter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (acc. to II. A.), <hi rend="ital">expressly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi> (late Lat. for the class. significanter): <cit><quote lang="la">signanter et breviter omnia indicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signanter et proprie dixerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44226.15" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">signātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n44226.16" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. <cb n="SIGN" /> 1. sealed; hence) <hi rend="ital">Shut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guarded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserved</hi> (mostly ante- and post-class.): signata sacra, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 397, 32</bibl>: limina. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 145: Chrysidem negat signatam reddere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">unharmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 171, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">assume de viduis fide pulchram, aetate signatam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44226.17" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II. A.) <hi rend="ital">Plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi> (post-class. for significans): <cit><quote lang="la">quid expressius atque signatius in hanc causam?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">signātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui (veteres) proprie atque signate locuti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signatius explicare aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
signum: <entryFree id="n44227" type="main" key="signum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">signum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. Sanscr. sag-, to cling to, adhere; cf. sigilla</etym>. <sense id="n44227.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indication</hi> (very frequent in all styles and periods; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">insigne): meo patri torulus inerit aureus Sub petaso: id signum Amphitruoni non erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 145 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 145 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eam (nutricem) adducam et signa ostendam haec, i. e. crepundia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fures earum rerum, quas ceperunt, signa commutant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:25:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 25, 74</bibl></cit>; so (with notae) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:41:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 41, 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 62</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omne probabile aut signum est aut credibile ... Signum est, quod sub sensum aliquem cadit et quiddam significat, quod ex ipso profectum videtur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:47 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 47 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut pecori signum aut numeros inpressit acervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 263</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">servitii signum cervice gerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculo mihi vulnera fecit.—Signa vides: apparet adhuc vetus ecce cicatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metam Constituit signum nautis pater, unde reverti Scirent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum signi gratia positum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa pedum,</quote> <trans><tr>tracks</tr>, <tr>prints</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 543</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:212 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 212 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis mihi signum dedit, Ne se appellarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere deos gallis signum dedisse cantandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:57 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 26, 57 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa esse ad salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi pudentis signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color pudoris signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa doloris ostendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timoris mittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to exhibit</tr>, <tr>display</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 71</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum hoc quoque signum est, dominam esse extra noxiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 17, 2</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">predic. gen.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi>: hoc est signi; <cit><quote lang="la">ubi primum poterit, se illinc subducet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id erit signi me invitum facere, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 38, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">88, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil tamen est signi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:918" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 918</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid signi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 16, 38, 2</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">a surname</hi>, <hi rend="ital">epithet</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">huic signum exercitus apposuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Am. 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44227.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44227.2" n="A" level="2"> In milit. lang. </sense><sense id="n44227.3" n="1" level="3"> The distinctive sign of a division of an army. </sense><sense id="n44227.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A military standard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ensign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banner</hi> (including the aquila): <cit><quote lang="la">signifero interfecto, signo amisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque signiferi viam, nec signa milites cernerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hasdrubal ut procul signa legionum fulgentia vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:9:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter signa militaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum unius signi militibus pergit ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa militaria ex proelio relata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 99</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">militaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 33, 19, § 58</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence the expressions: signa sequi,</quote> <trans><tr>to follow the standards</tr>, <tr>to march in military order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 80:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 80, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa subsequi,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep in order of battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa observare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 34, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab signis discedere,</quote> <trans><tr>to desert the standards</tr>, <tr>leave the ranks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 33</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 20 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ordinibus signisque discedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa relinquere,</quote> <trans><tr>to desert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa deserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 34, 9</bibl></cit>: signa ferre, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to break up</hi> the camp, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 5 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: movere signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 14, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 236</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:61:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 61, 2</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Alex. 57, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">but: ferte signa in hostem,</quote> <trans><tr>attack</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 23, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa constituere,</quote> <trans><tr>to halt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infestis contra hostes signis constiterunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa proferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to advance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32, 10</bibl></cit>: signa convertere, <hi rend="ital">to wheel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">face about</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 26</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 29</bibl>; for which, <pb n="1698" /> <cb n="SIGN" /> vertere signa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa inferre (in aliquem),</quote> <trans><tr>to advance to the attack</tr>, <tr>make an assault</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:12" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 12</bibl> al; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">signa conferre cum aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to engage with</tr>, <tr>engage in close fight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 21, 49</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and cf.: collatis signis pugnare, superare aliquem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:23:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 23, 66</bibl>; but conferre signa also means simply <hi rend="ital">to bring the standards together</hi> (to one place), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa in laevum cornu confert,</quote> <trans><tr>concentrates his troops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa transferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to desert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: signa convellere, <hi rend="ital">to take up the standards</hi>, which had been fixed in the ground, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:54:10" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 54, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 37, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vellere signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 50, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">revellere signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 77</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">signa figere,</quote> <trans><tr>to encamp</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defigere signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:625" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 625</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub signis ducere legiones, ire, esse, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>together</tr>, <tr>in order</tr>, <tr>in rank and file</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 71</bibl></cit> (with ordine); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa hostium turbare,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw into disorder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante signa,</quote> <trans><tr>before the army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44227.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">infestis prope signis inferuntur Galli in Fonteium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:20:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 20, 44</bibl></cit> (16, 34).—</sense><sense id="n44227.6" n="b" level="4"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the standard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ensign</hi> of single cohorts and maniples (opp. aquila, the standard of the entire legion): <cit><quote lang="la">cum fasces, cum tubas, cum signa militaria, cum aquilam illam argenteam ... scirem esse praemissam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; Galb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 30, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Oud.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 3, 4, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:224 al" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 224 al.</bibl> (cf. aquila, 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">manipulos exercitus minimas manus quae unum sequuntur signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=88" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 88</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n44227.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cohort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a maniple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">octo cohortes in fronte constituit, reliquarum signa in subsidio artius collocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:23" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 23</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 33, 1; 27, 14; 28, 14; Auct. B. Hisp. 18, 3.—</sense><sense id="n44227.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signal; a watchword</hi>, <hi rend="ital">password</hi>, given by a wind-instrument, by the tessera, or otherwise: <cit><quote lang="la">signum tubā dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelii committendi dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipiendi dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptui dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:45" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum dare ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelii exposcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 92 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 99:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 99, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:47" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:3 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 3 al.</bibl> (v. cano).—For the chariot race: <cit><quote lang="la">signum mittendis quadrigis dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: signum mittere, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl>: signo Felicitatis dato, <hi rend="ital">the word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watchword</hi>, Felicitas, Auct. B. Afr. 83: <cit><quote lang="la">signum petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">it bello tessera signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 637</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu illam (virtutem) jubes signum petere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be in subjection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44227.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sign</hi> or <hi rend="ital">token</hi> of any thing to come; <hi rend="ital">a prognostic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">symptom</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">portentum, indicium): ipse et equus ejus repente concidit: nec eam rem habuit religioni, objecto signo, ut peritis videbatur, ne committeret proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medici signa quaedam habent ex venis et ex spiritu aegroti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 70, 145</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 440</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 503</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 253</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospera signa dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18</bibl></cit> (19), 152.—</sense><sense id="n44227.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An image</hi>, as a work of art; <hi rend="ital">a figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">picture</hi>, etc. (syn.: effigies, imago, simulacrum); <cit><quote lang="la">inerant (classi) signa expressa, Titani quomodo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>: statuas deorum, exempla earum facierum, s gna domi pro supellectile statuere, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 782</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">signum pictum in pariete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum in fano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëna signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante signum Jovis Statoris concidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum aeneum, marmoreum, eburneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 41, 147</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 248</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cratera impressum signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 536</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 267</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 263</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vestis) auro signisque ingentibus apta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ornatis aedibus per aulaea et signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 23, 2</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">pallam signis auroque rigentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e Pario formatum marmore signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 419</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:183" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 183</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 398: statuas, signa, picturas commendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44227.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An image</hi> or <hi rend="ital">device on a seal-ring; a seal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signet</hi>: ostendi tabellas Lentulo, et quaesivi, cognosceretne signum. <cb n="SILE" /> Annuit. Est vero, inquam, notum signum, imago avi tui, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(patera) in cistulā obsignata signo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 265</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:45:section=117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 45, § 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae maximae signis hominum nobilium consignantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imprimat his signa tabellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae integris signis praetoribus traduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 47, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signo laeso non insanire lagenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumen sub signo habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to have under seal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub signo claustrisque rei publicae positum vectigal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec pacta conventaque inpressis signis custodirentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sol duodena peregit signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 618</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44227.12" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sign in the heavens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi> (cf. sidus): <cit><quote lang="la">caeli subter labentia signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca caelio Omnia, dispositis signis ornata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signorum ortus et obitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signis omnibus ad idem principium stellisque revocatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 22, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in signo leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 53, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signorum obitus speculari et ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 257</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 138</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum pluviale Capellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:113" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponemusque suos ad vaga signa dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:310" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox caelo diffundere signa parabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 8, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44227.13" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Miraculous works</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 3, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:24:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 24, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Joan. 2, 11</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
sil: <entryFree id="n44228" type="main" key="sil1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sil</orth>, <itype>silis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n44228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of yellowish earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yellow ochre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 56, § 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 28</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12</bibl>, Gram. 8.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n44229" type="main" key="sil2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sil</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sili</orth>, = seselis.</entryFree>
sila: <entryFree id="n44230" type="main" key="Si_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large forest in the country of the</hi> Bruttii, <hi rend="ital">which yielded great quantities of pitch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 22, 85</bibl>; Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 715</bibl> (H. 4, 7 Dietsch); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 219</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 715</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the forest of Sila</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
silaceus: <entryFree id="n44231" type="main" key="sila_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silācĕus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">silācĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. sil</etym>, <sense id="n44231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like ochre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of ochre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 7, 32, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silana: <entryFree id="n44232" type="main" key="Silana"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Silana</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silanio: <entryFree id="n44233" type="main" key="Silani^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Silanĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Silanĭion</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated statuary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7</bibl>, praef.</sense></entryFree>
silanus: <entryFree id="n44234" type="main" key="Si_la_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the Julian</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 2</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n44234.1" n="a" level="4"> D. Junius Silanus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 50, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:51:16" default="NO" valid="yes">51, 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44234.2" n="b" level="4"> M. Silanus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 35, 135</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fan 10, 30</bibl>. 1.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlānĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">named from one Silanus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 5, 1</bibl></cit>, §§ 7 and 21.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44235" type="greek" key="si_la_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīlānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">silhno/s</foreign>, Doric <foreign lang="greek">silano/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jet of water</hi> (usually spirting from a head of Silenus). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1265</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; Fest. s. v. tullios, p. 352 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3321</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 169" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n44236" type="main" key="Si_la_nus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlānus</orth>, v. Sila <sense id="n44236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
silarus: <entryFree id="n44237" type="main" key="Si^la^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭlărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*si/laris</foreign>, <sense id="n44237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river forming the boundary between Lucania and Campania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sele</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 70</bibl> (al. Silerus) sq.; 2, 103, 106, § 226; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:582" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 582</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Silerus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Siler</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 426</bibl>; Col. poët. 10, 136.</sense></entryFree>
silatum: <entryFree id="n44238" type="gloss" key="silatum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silatum</orth> <itype>antiqui pro eo, quod nunc jentaculum dicimus, appellabant, quia jejuni vinum sili conditum ante meridiem absorbebant</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=347" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 347</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
silaus: <entryFree id="n44239" type="main" key="silaus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silaus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of parsley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smallage</hi>: Apium graveolens, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 56, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silenicus: <entryFree id="n44240" type="main" key="Si_le_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlēnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Silenus</etym>, <sense id="n44240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sacred to Silenus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">racemi (hederae),</quote> <trans><tr>a species of ivy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 146</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
silens: <entryFree id="n44241" type="main" key="si^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of sileo.</entryFree>
silenter: <entryFree id="n44242" type="main" key="si^lenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sileo, <sense id="n44242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
silentiarius: <entryFree id="n44243" type="main" key="si^lenti^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlentĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>silentium</etym>. <sense id="n44243.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A confidential domestic servant</hi> (orig. watching for the domestic silence; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 3</bibl>), Salv. Gub. Dei, 4, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2956</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3193</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 99 (2d. ed.).— </sense><sense id="n44243.1" n="II" level="1"> In the later imperial period, <hi rend="ital">a certain high officer at court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a privy-councillor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 28, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 62, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silentiose: <entryFree id="n44244" type="main" key="si^lenti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlentĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. silentiosus <sense id="n44244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
silentiosus: <entryFree id="n44245" type="main" key="si^lenti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlentĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>silentium</etym>, <sense id="n44245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perfectly still</hi> or <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>: nactus opacae noctis<cb n="SILE" />  silentiosa secreta, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.—Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlentĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">stilly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentiose geritur publicum bonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
silentium: <entryFree id="n44246" type="main" key="si^lenti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlentĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sileo</etym>. <sense id="n44246.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44246.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a being still</hi> or <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noiselessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stillness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silence</hi> (freq. and class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">taciturnitas): otium et silentium est, Ter.
